 Manager, System Partnerships: Manager, System Partnerships Location: Detroit, Michigan (preferred) or Cleveland, Ohio Available: Immediately WHO WE ARE Achievement Network (ANet) is a nonprofit dedicated to educational equity. We help schools boost student learning with great teaching that’s grounded in standards, informed by data, and built on the successful practices of educators around the country. Founded in 2005, ANet now serves over 700 schools educating over 230,000 students across the country. Our support has consistently helped our partner schools—both district and charter—achieve breakthrough results for their students. ANet has received multiple awards and recognitions, most recently receiving the highest ratings (Tier 1) on our math and ELA formative assessments from the Louisiana Department of Education, the only organization to receive such high marks. We were also named to The NonProfit Time’s “Best Nonprofits to Work For” and in the 2018-19 school year will be launching the Breakthrough Results Fund, a four-year collaboration to prove what’s possible in instructional improvement. ANet is a dynamic, values driven, team-oriented organization that is committed to the growth and development of all staff members. Individuals who join ANet have the opportunity to join an exceptional team of colleagues committed to helping schools drive excellent teaching and learning by investing in each other and learning together. THE OPPORTUNITY The Central East Region consists of partnerships primarily in Michigan and Ohio with a growing presence in Indiana, serving both district and charter schools and systems. With an ambitious growth plan, ANet is committed to advancing equity in this region and helping to raise the bar on teaching and learning across these states. We are seeking a full-time Manager, System Partnerships. The Manager will have multiple responsibilities in supporting the service leads across the region. The Manager will support the local network director in coordinating with the districts and work closely across internal ANet teams to support strong execution of our district partnerships. The Manager will be ultimately responsible for managing and executing on a system-wide implementation plan leading to effective internal and external communication, logistical support in partnership with the district project managers and stakeholders, tight coordination and alignment with the district, and overall smooth implementation. The Manager will report to the Vice President of the Central East Region. The ideal candidate would bring direct experience working in and alongside schools and/or district leadership teams, as well as excellent project management skills and comfort in leveraging data to achieve strong outcomes. This person will need to be highly organized, detail-oriented, entrepreneurial and motivated by having ownership over logistics and execution of work in support of our system partners. District partnership support: Project manage district partnerships across the region towards positive outcomes and impact Coordinating clear communications and effective implementation plans with district partners; manage internal team and influence district partners towards deadlines and goals Map implications of decisions across systems and across larger network teams in tight partnership with network lead and network associates Succinctly tee up and make recommendations to executive directors and network leaders on key decisions and trade-offs at critical moments based on deep analysis, district context, and consultation with internal teams Manage the day to day implementation of the system service with expert project management and communication skills and acute awareness of the myriad of stakeholders, predicting conflicts and proactively troubleshooting towards solutions. This could include planning and executing ongoing internal/external huddles, liaising with different district departments, and serving as the general point of contact for our district partners. Work with ANet’s Program Operations Team and partner systems/schools to coordinate logistics for the effective administration of interim assessments – a critical component of our model Communicate clearly and facilitate towards outcomes in formal and informal settings with district contacts, such as presenting key project information to multiple stakeholders, headlining assessment data to highlight instructional takeaways, and connecting across district teams to clarify and enforce complex messages. This may include writing simple, clear messages that district partners can use to communicate within a system and to their schools. Partner with Business Development team to understand procurement and reporting requirements for our district partners and support efforts to ensure timely and full payment for our services Event Management Organize and communicate all details for professional learning events related to our district partnerships, including but not limited to securing contracts for presenters and space, preparing materials, setting up event space, and other details to create outstanding events, with support as needed from local Network Associate and national Event Management team. Coordinating clear communications and effective implementation plans specific to district events; manage internal team and influence district partners towards deadlines and goals As needed, serve as facilitator for professional learning experiences for systems, leaders, and teachers Serve as Professional Learning liaison for regional teams, owning network/region’s core model professional learning strategy and the ongoing management for executing strong professional learning engagements, working with own team and professional learning team to create an annual plan, owning project/team management for professional learning events (includes supporting team to internalize, customize, and prepare for facilitation of content), plans for and leads team in debriefing after events. partners with network associate on logistics, and attends regular liaison calls to share what’s working and problem solve about challenges Data Management and Insights Support a data-driven team culture through data collection, tracking, and reporting as it relates to relevant system partnership data: regional events, practice tracking, partnership strength surveys, and assessment administration Track program against outcomes and a strong project plan, synthesizing projects for stakeholders, teeing up decisions and timelines, flagging challenges, and elevating bright spots Manage the execution of our partnership strength surveys as it pertains to unique needs within the district context Work with ANet’s Program Operations Team and partner systems to deliver requested ANet data back to the district (interim, practice tracking, partnership strength survey data) WHO YOU ARE & WHAT YOU BRING In order to be successful in this role, candidates must demonstrate the following: You believe in ANet’s mission and share our passion for increasing opportunities for children in underserved communities while operating with a sense of urgency in the support of schools You are committed to living out ANet’s Core Values daily and are open to examining personal archetypes and bias and discussing topics related to race, class, and privilege which relate to our Advance Equity and People Matter values You bring direct experience working in and alongside schools and district leadership teams, as well as excellent project management skills and comfort in leveraging data to achieve strong outcomes. You sweat the small stuff and bring exceptional attention to detail to everything you do You have managed complex projects in the past and are skilled in managing multiple tasks, actions, and people simultaneously You know how to quickly build relationships, understand context, and gain trust internally and externally You are an exceptional communicator and know how to get creative in order to get a message across to both internal and external stakeholders You get excited about supporting others to do their best work and consistently go above and beyond in meeting the needs of your team and external partners You enjoy digging into data with an analytical eye to determine the story that it’s telling you, and headline that data for others in a way that inspires action You are flexible and when things don’t go as planned, you proactively problem-solve to seek out new solutions and opportunities You are your happiest and most successful in entrepreneurial, collaborative, and fast-paced environments You are eager to learn and proactively seek out feedback and opportunities for your professional growth Ideal candidates may also demonstrate the following preferred qualifications: You have prior experience using tools such as Cvent, Tableau, Excel and Salesforce You have prior experience in classroom instruction or with facilitating academic content WHAT WE OFFER ANet offers highly competitive compensation based on prior experience and qualifications as well as comprehensive benefits in order to best support our people. Benefits we offer include: health, dental and vision insurance where ANet pays 80% of the cost of these benefits for employees and their families/domestic partner; 3 weeks of vacation (4 weeks after two years with ANet); 10 paid holidays with paid days off between the Christmas and New Year’s holidays; a paid floating holiday; paid sick & personal days; paid parental leave; retirement plan options; commuter benefits; tuition reimbursement; flexible spending accounts; short and long-term disability coverage; and basic life and personal accident insurance. We’re seeking an experienced and multidisciplinary creative professional with the ability to blend creative problem solving, compelling storytelling and strong business acumen into custom polished visuals through a variety of mediums. This role combines strategic thinking with creative execution to bring consumers to life for our clients, and leading others to do the same. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Act as creative lead and design advocate on complex engagements: Bring strong creative leadership to all project stages from proposal and execution to delivery and presentation Distill complex ideas and concepts and confidently articulate a creative vision to both internal teams and clients – if you see the potential, you can make it a reality Enjoy learning from and partnering with others – taking direction or providing it – and integrate seamlessly in cross-functional teams Apply multidisciplinary design expertise, drawing on experience from various industries in diverse mediums Manage deadlines and workload in a fast-paced environment requiring flexibility and resourcefulness Deliver design-centric solutions as a key differentiator of Gongos: Collaborate with Account teams, Business Development and Marketing to shape our go-to-market strategy Advocate for the power of design and educate on the creative process Advance internal design competency and technical skills while serving as a strong role model for professional development Partner with other expert areas to build advocates and further embed design through the delivery of great work Sought after for thought leadership and value added to work Translate business knowledge into informative, engaging and inspirational pieces to aid in decision-making for top executives: Bring consumer stories to life through an empathic design approach, visual storytelling, and strong aesthetic Leverage strong business acumen to understand our clients’ businesses and the challenges they’re facing Cultivate an interest and aptitude in information design – translating complex data into visuals that are beautiful and consumable PERKS THAT SET US APART Flexibility and time to recharge!  Academic Services Officer I/II: Office of Federal TRiO. This is a subsidy conditioned appointment. The Academic Services Officer (ETS Academic Coordinator) is responsible for coordinating the Educational Talent Search (ETS) project. The position requires the ability to manage time, multi-task, and function successfully with little supervision. It includes providing pre-college awareness and assistance to participants and their families at target schools and their communities. This individual will also assist the director and assistant director with other duties and grant related responsibilities as necessary. Specifically, the Academic Services Officer II (ETS Academic Coordinator) has responsibility for the ETS academic program including participant recruitment, enrollment, needs assessment, and the ITSS Tutorial Program, Successful ETS participant enrollment and completion in Advanced Placement Courses. PSAT-SAT and MME test preparation services. Target school site responsibility for compliance with Federal program requirements. The Academic Coordinator sits on the ETS College Council, and is responsible for implementation of ETS collaborations with, Target School Teachers, Administrators, Parents, Counselors, Community and WSU Unique Duties Qualifications Qualifications: Bachelors Degree in Education, Student Affairs, Human Services, Curriculum & Instruction or a related field required for ASO I. Masters degree required for ASO II. Certified H.S. Instructor, or Licensed Practical Counselor. (LPC). Experience Designing, Managing or Implementing Similar Programs. Five years related experience and/or training in managing tutorial, standardized test preparation, supplemental instruction or AP programs, or implementing academic college readiness initiatives. Experience with federal TRIO programs is strongly preferred. Willing to become familiar with TRIO regulations that govern program policies and procedures. Strong desire to promote educational achievement and opportunity. Training in growth mindset interventions and underrepresented students is preferred. The ability to work independently and effectively with staff, participants, parents, community partners and school personnel of diverse backgrounds and varying educational levels. Must be competent with online/alternative learning support technologies and methods. Computer skills to effectively conduct electronically based business, communication, record keeping, presentations, and utilization of campus resources. Competent in evaluating and mentoring the performance of others for success. Competence in decision making, organization, and time management skills with a high attention to details. Requires day, evening, and occasional weekend hours and travel; college committee assignments; professional development; and other duties as assigned. Possess a valid driver's license with a good driving record. Reliable transportation. Multi-year grant funded position by the U.S. Department of Education. WSU encourages applications from women, people of color, and other underrepresented people. Wayne State is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer. Merchandising Specialist: What does a Best Buy Merchandising Specialist do? At Best Buy our mission is to leverage the unique talents and passions of our employees to inspire, delight, and enrich the lives of our customers through technology and all its possibilities. If you have a passion and curiosity for what is possible and enjoy people, we invite you to join us on this mission. This position is responsible to implement assigned responsibilities from Merchandising Senior in merchandising designated areas, upstocks merchandise to ensure department is continually stocked and replenished, and confirms the accuracy and timeliness of implementing special program guidelines. You will also assist customers in locating product. 45% of your time you will: Following weekly merchandising packet instructions, merchandises designated areas: Checks in drop shipments, truck shipments, and GEO shuttles. Confirms products are put on sales floor properly and in a timely manner. Arranges product according to planogram specifications. Performs ad set, price change, clean & bright, functionality and farming duties. Insure check-out lanes are set with proper product in each line. 25% of your time you will: Monitors floor merchandise: Upstocks overstock product when necessary. Downstocks product when necessary. Moves all product off of the sales floor prior to opening. 20% of your time you will: Ensures program guidelines are followed: Confirms Raincheck Follow up is completed. Confirms functionality checks are complete and problems reported to the manager. Brings "lock-up" product to front checkout lanes for customer purchases. Confirms closeout and open item program guidelines are followed. 10% of your time you will: Greets customer and assists with locating product What are the professional requirements of an Merchandising Specialist? Basic Qualifications Ability to work successfully as part of a team Ability to work a flexible schedule inclusive of holidays, nights and weekends Ability to lift or maneuver 50-100 pounds, with or without accommodations Preferred Qualifications 3 months experience in retail, customer service or related fields What are my rewards and benefits? Surrounded by the latest and greatest technology, a team of amazing coworkers and a work environment where anything is possible, you’ll find it easy to be your best when you work at Best Buy. While you’re making technology work for our customers, we’re making sure Best Buy works for you with our pay for performance philosophy. At Best Buy we offer top salaries for management, including both short and long term incentive plans based upon business results, as well as endless opportunities to grow in a dynamic work environment that’s part of an industry that never sleeps. From tuition reimbursement to deep employee discounts, to health, wealth and wellness benefits, we believe the success of our company depends on the passion of employees for learning, technology and people.
 Director of School Support, Michigan: Director of School Support – Michigan Network Location: Metro Detroit Area Position is available: June 2018 WHO WE ARE Achievement Network (ANet) is a nonprofit dedicated to educational equity. We help schools boost student learning with great teaching that’s grounded in standards, informed by data, and built on the successful practices of educators around the country. Founded in 2005, ANet now serves over 700 schools educating over 230,000 students in California, Colorado, Connecticut, District of Columbia, Illinois, Louisiana, Massachusetts, Michigan, New Jersey, New York, Ohio, and Tennessee. Our support has consistently helped our partner schools—both district and charter—achieve breakthrough results for their students. ANet has received multiple awards and recognitions, including a prestigious Investing In Innovation (i3) grant from the federal government in 2010, New Schools Venture Fund’s “Organization of the Year” in 2011, and The NonProfit Time’s “Best Nonprofits to Work For” in 2015 and 2016. ANet is a dynamic, values driven, team-oriented organization that is committed to the growth and development of all staff members. Individuals who join ANet have the opportunity to join an exceptional team of colleagues committed to helping schools drive excellent teaching and learning by investing in each other and learning together. THE OPPORTUNITY We are seeking influential academic leaders who are passionate about increasing student achievement to serve as a Director of School Support (DSS), working to support our service to schools in Michigan as part of ANet’s Central East Region. With a deep commitment to the metro Detroit area, ANet is committed to advancing equity and helping to raise the bar on teaching and learning across the Michigan Network and this DSS will play a crucial role in ensuring our partner schools achieve breakthrough results for students. The DSS will work with leaders to build a school culture where learning standards, achievement data, and teacher development are used to achieve breakthrough learning for students. The DSS will be responsible for coaching and developing leadership in approximately 12-14 schools in the Michigan Network, reaching more than 200 teachers and 6,000 students. The Director of School Support will report directly to and work closely with the Executive Director of the Michigan Network while also work in a highly collaborative and supportive fashion with the Michigan Network Team, as well as with peer coaches across ANet’s other regions and national teams. WHAT YOU’LL DO Partner with and coach school leaders to strengthen instruction and increase student achievement Serve as an instructional leadership coach for school leaders, inspiring and motivating teams, supporting school-wide change management, and building expertise in standards-based and data-driven instruction and teacher development Develop school leaders and teachers on effective use of real-time data from the ANet interim assessments to target student misunderstandings, to improve teacher practice, and to continually deepen understanding of the rigor of the Common Core standards Train and coach school leaders and teachers on effective backwards planning using state standards, complex texts, and curricula to achieve student mastery of grade-level content Analyze student data and use research-based practices to inform an individualized strategy for coaching each school Serve as a leadership coach for school leaders, partnering with them to overcome barriers to successful data-driven instruction and increased student achievement, including how to develop and leverage school-wide practices and structures to build a culture of achievement that accelerates student impact Engage in a gradual release of support to build some schools’ independence with teacher development, first by modeling meeting facilitation, then observing and providing coaching and feedback to leaders on their facilitation Develop a strong network of ANet schools Connect school leaders with other schools to facilitate best practice sharing Design and lead professional development sessions for groups of school leaders and teachers Support the regional leadership in growing the Network by sustaining current school partners and fostering new partnerships Support internal ANet strength and growth Develop tools, coaching strategies, and innovative ideas for the organization that improve our ability to coach schools Serve in internal ANet leadership roles, which could include recruiting and hiring, network event coordination, sales, professional development planning and facilitation, and strategy development WHO YOU ARE AND WHAT YOU BRING In order to be successful in this role, candidates must demonstrate the following: You have a passionate commitment to and a sense of urgency for the support of schools, along with a belief that all students can achieve at high levels; you believe in the power of formative assessment, coaching, and professional development as critical levers in school improvement. You are energized by roles where no day will be the same, but where instructional excellence is at the heart of everything you do. You bring prior experience managing or coaching other adults (e.g. school leadership, instructional coaching, etc.) and know how to develop and motivate others to drive results, while balancing humility and assertiveness. You thrive off building strong relationships, especially when it comes to building trust and credibility quickly. You have a proven track record of results as a teacher and/or instructional leader using standards and data to drive instruction; you know what excellent instructional practices look like at the classroom, grade, and school level. You can connect the dots in ambiguous circumstances and know how to use your analytical and problem-solving skills to plan and facilitate strong outcomes in meetings and through facilitation of instructional content. You have excellent communication skills and are able to read and respond to unspoken and implicit cues; you are a compelling presenter and facilitator who can explain complex problems and solutions in clear, concise and engaging ways. You are motivated by working in an environment where we live out our core values daily; you are eager to examine personal archetypes and biases while discussing topics related to race, class, and privilege which relate to ANet’s Advance Equity and People Matter values. You are willing to travel across the Region to the partner schools and systems within your portfolio and have access to a vehicle (mileage will be reimbursed) and/or public transportation in order to do so. Ideal candidates may also demonstrate the following preferred qualifications: You bring familiarity implementing the Common Core instructional shifts, as teacher and/or as an instructional coach, specifically in math and/or ELA You have prior experience coaching teams, leading professional development, and/or managing programs at a district/CMO-level WHAT WE OFFER ANet offers highly competitive compensation based on prior experience and qualifications as well as comprehensive benefits in order to best support our people. Benefits we offer include: health, dental and vision insurance where ANet pays 80% of the cost of these benefits for employees and their families/domestic partner; 3 weeks of vacation (4 weeks after two years with ANet); 10 paid holidays with paid days off between the Christmas and New Year’s holidays; a paid floating holiday; paid sick & personal days; paid parental leave; retirement plan options; commuter benefits; tuition reimbursement; flexible spending accounts; short and long-term disability coverage; and basic life and personal accident insurance. HOW TO APPLY Applications submitted by April 20, 2018 are guaranteed to be reviewed. Candidates who apply by that deadline will be updated by the week of April 23rd regarding any next steps in the hiring process. To apply, please click on the blue “Apply” button. You will then be prompted to complete a brief application and upload a resume and thoughtful cover letter in which you outline why you are interested in working for ANet and how your skills and experience meet the qualifications of the position. ANet is committed to maximizing the diversity of our organization. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage individuals of all ethnic and racial backgrounds and gender identities to apply to our positions.
Asset Protection Associate: What does a Best Buy Asset Protection Associate do? At Best Buy our mission is to leverage the unique talents and passions of our employees to inspire, delight, and enrich the lives our customers through technology and all its possibilities. If you have a passion and curiosity for what is possible and enjoy people, we invite you to join us on this mission. A Best Buy Asset Protection Associate coaches and leads employees in asset protection best practices to ensure a safe, secure and profitable environment throughout the store. They work with the Asset Protection Lead to resolve any hazards or compliance issues and investigate any accidents. They also demonstrate preparedness and exhibit behaviors for proper emergency response procedures. At Best Buy we give you plenty of ways to challenge yourself. You’ll find working in a high-paced retail environment increases your ability to solve problems, multitask and work in a team environment. Further, our leadership is committed to helping you succeed in your current role and prepare you for the next through coaching and performance appraisals. 40% of your time you will: Monitor the store for potential security risks and alarm function. Protect against fraudulent activity by creating AP Alerts and reporting and documenting incidents properly when necessary. 30% of your time you will: Teach and coach store employees about the principles, standards and policies related to safety and crisis events and monitor their fulfillment. Work with the Asset Protection Lead and others to resolve any hazards or compliance issues and investigate any employee or customer accidents. 30% of your time you will: Interact with customers and store employees to maintain a safe and profitable environment. Sales Representative-Detroit MI Neuroscience Primary Care: As a Neurosciences Primary Care Sales Representative you are responsible for effectively handling a defined territory with a customer focused approach on the health care providers in that territory. Territory Management: Develop and implement territory business plans to deliver strong sales results and achieve sales targets Represent Lilly as a leader in the Neurosciences community and marketplace Operate with high integrity and follow all Lilly policies and procedures Customer Focus: Promote product portfolio to HCPs through value-based conversations and communicate safety, efficacy, and treatment expectations Partner with customers to understand practice workflow and patient needs within the practice Provide resources that enhance or exceed customer needs for disease-state information and product-specific support Assist and coordinate critical activities with physicians and office staff through the drug initiation process, device training, patient support programs, and follow-up where applicable Collaborate and partner with peers in the Neurosciences sales organization, brand team, and other support partners to deliver an extraordinary customer experience Connect with access specialists, and other commercial partners to ensure a positive patient experience with treatment Disease State and Neuroscience Market Knowledge: Develop deep disease-state, product, and competitor knowledge, as well as understanding local and regional market trends Share key findings with teammates to serve as a learning resource within the Geo-managed team Earn reputation as a subject-matter authority and a valued resource Company Overview Are you seeking a career that makes a difference in the world? Would you like a career where you can use your sales experience and skills? At Lilly, we serve an extraordinary purpose. We make a difference for people around the globe by discovering, developing and delivering medicines that help them live longer, healthier, more active lives. Not only do we deliver breakthrough medications, but you also can count on us to develop creative solutions to support communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. For over 25 years, Lilly has been committed to helping people suffering from migraine, investigating more than a dozen different compounds for the treatment of migraine and disabling headache disorders. These research programs have accelerated understanding of this disease and advanced the development of Lilly's comprehensive late-stage development programs studying the launch of a Migraine portfolio for prevention of migraine and cluster headache, and for the acute treatment of migraine. Our goal is to make life better for people with migraine by offering comprehensive solutions to prevent or stop this disabling disease. The combined clinical, academic and professional experience of our experts helps us to build our research portfolio, identify challenges for healthcare providers and pinpoint the needs of people living with migraine and cluster headache. Sound interesting to you? Read on to find out more about how you can join our sales team, where you will enjoy meaningful work, build a successful career and make important contributions to our patients’ lives. Instructional Coach: POSITION DESCRIPTION ? INSTRUCTIONAL COACH Vision: ?Pursuit of Excellence? Our team consists of individuals with years of educational leadership and operational experience that operate at the highest level of integrity, customer service and excellence treating your academy as if it was our own. We believe your success is EAS Schools? success and are committed to achieving it. Core Values: Performance with Passion Resourcefulness Integrity Direction with Commitment Excellence in all we do __________________________________________________________________________ TITLE: Instructional Coach FLSA STATUS: Exempt REPORTS TO: Principal SUPERVISES: General Education Classroom Teachers LOCATION: Southwest Detroit Community School POSITION SUMMARY The Instructional Coach (IC) is part of the EAS Schools? leadership team and will work closely with the Principal to support academic leadership and achievement throughout the school. The IC will be instructionally focused, providing support and coaching to teachers as they work to ensure that each student reaches her or his academic potential. With the support of the Principal, the IC is also responsible for ensuring strong student culture, thus creating the optimal learning environment for academic achievement. An effective IC will ensure that our school?s instructional program and school environment prepares every student for success in life. The IC will also be responsible for delivering content-based professional development and developing department and grade level chairs. The IC?s job is to support the school in driving academic and character outcomes for students as a key member of the school?s leadership team. We expect our IC to lead both instruction and school culture and also to be able to develop leadership in the school?s emerging teacher leaders. The IC is an active member of the school leadership team and reports to the Principal. PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS The Instructional Coach is responsible for managing, coaching, developing, and supporting instructional staff in accordance with the mission, vision, philosophy and policies of EAS Schools. The Instructional Coach performance measures will include, but not be limited to: Rapport with staff, students, parents, and others School-wide student achievement growth versus target Staff and stakeholder satisfaction ? primarily as measured by surveys Staff attendance versus target Staff retention versus target Demonstrated knowledge of assigned content area(s) including appropriate instructional strategies and available resources CRITICAL WORK The Instructional Coach leads, manages and develops teachers by executing on the following duties: Observe teachers and provide expert advice on improving and enhancing individual lessons and units based on ongoing analysis. This will include, but is not limited to: o Reviewing lesson plans, unit plans, and assessments o Understanding scope and sequence models o Observing classroom instruction and offering comprehensive analysis and feedback o Providing instructional strategy best practice training, as needed o Supporting the development of curriculum, using the backward design model and advising scope and sequence based on essential content knowledge that addresses state and national standards o Review assessment tools on a regular and on-going basis and analyze performance for effectiveness in improving student achievement Lead data-driven instruction Hold teachers accountable to deliverables and results Supports teachers in understanding process and roles in student support and intervention and develops systems and structures to ensure that limited time is spent on reactive student discipline Act as the first Leadership Team contact on student intervention and parent engagement hierarchy; determines next steps for issues that rise above the teacher or grade level chair Work collaboratively with the Principal around the instructional staff evaluation process Ensure that students meet their annual NWEA goals Develop and lead the instructional coaching model for the school; work with other coaches to ensure a consistent coaching model across the school Develop and lead school-wide professional development for teachers and staff Support the Principal in identifying and developing emerging teacher leaders through goal setting, coaching and providing feedback Assist the Principal in the development of an academic vision and strategic plan Collaborate with other members of the school leadership team to ensure high quality implementation of the schools? educational design, including school culture, standards, assessments, and instructional guidelines Takes an active role in investing and mobilizing teachers to achieve the collective goals of the school; owns the implementation of select school priorities in support of the school-wide vision As a leader on the academic team, make recommendations on best practices for supporting curriculum alignment across all grade levels; continue to advise and monitor this progress as the school grows by grade level towards creating a comprehensive and aligned curriculum for K through twelfth grade Manage parts of the daily school operations (e.g. arrival/dismissal, lunch/recess, school trips) Collaborate with Principal on hiring and on-boarding of staff when appropriate MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS EDUCATION: Bachelor?s Degree (required); Master?s Degree (preferred) EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS: Strong candidates for this position will demonstrate an unwavering focus on student achievement and a record of success in leading teams, people and instruction. Additional qualifications include: Unquestioned Integrity Humility Vision Commitment to justice Independence and initiative Effective collaboration skills Demonstrated student achievement results in own classroom and from teachers that she/he manages Ability to push staff while inspiring them A minimum of 3+ years teaching in a high-needs setting (preferably urban) Curricular and instructional leadership experience Possession of a passionate and loving attitude toward all children A deep passion for social justice and equity for all children; a strong belief that all students can achieve at the highest levels regardless of demography Demonstrated ability to create inclusive environments that honors and supports a diversity of backgrounds and perspectives Demonstrated ability to lead and manage leaders Ability to evaluate instructional programs and teaching effectiveness Excellent communication, public relations, and interpersonal skills Adept at data analysis; ability to extract meaningful insights across school- wide data Willingness to take on additional roles and responsibilities as assigned Strong culture building/ behavior management skill Ability to work both on broad-based strategy and everyday details Ability to be flexible and adapt to changing priorities Ability to interpret policy, procedures, and data Proven written and verbal communication skills Strong organizational and planning skills Responsiveness; Follow-up and follow-through with students, families, and faculty members is essential Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook) This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by an incumbent in this job and the qualifications needed. The job description should not be construed as an exhaustive list of all job duties that may be performed by a person so classified and should not be construed as an exhaustive list of all qualifications that may be required.

Best Buy Verizon Expert: What does a Best Buy Verizon Expert do? At Best Buy we deliver expert service at unbeatable prices – all in a fun, high-energy, play-to-win environment that is unlike any other. The Verizon Expert is responsible for creating a world-class shopping experience for our customers while meeting their technology needs with Verizon products and services. The Verizon Expert must build quality relationships with retail consumers and provide them with relevant and memorable Verizon product demonstrations. The Verizon Expert provides full-service and solutions support to customers in the Verizon Experience. The Verizon Expert is responsible for delivering profitability by achieving revenue, margin, solutions and operational targets. They also work closely with other employees to demonstrate, promote and sell Verizon products and services within the Mobile Phone department. A Best Buy Verizon Expert: Acts as a trusted subject matter expert, brand advocate and product champion for Verizon products and services. Actively engages customers using selling skills to increase sales of Verizon products and services in the designated Verizon Experience and, secondarily, in the Mobile Phone department. Staff Research Associate I/II: We are a team of experimental and computational biologists with the goal of understanding how genetic differences between individuals create variability in cellular function and ultimately disease susceptibility. This effort builds on the development and application of cutting edge genomic (RNA-seq, ATAC-seq, single cell RNA-seq) and computational technologies (linear mixed models, deep learning). We focus on the human immune response as our model system and collaborate extensively with clinicians and immunologists. The research will increase our understanding of how genetics influence cellular function in health and disease. The Staff Research Associate I/II (SRA I/II) will play an important role in supporting various experimental efforts in the lab. The SRA I/II will interact primarily with the lab manager and graduate students. INSTITUTE FOR HUMAN GENETICS Institute of Human Genetics (IHG) and UCSF provide a vibrant research environment with close links to top academic institutions across the Bay Area and provide the potential for your contributions to be used and recognized worldwide. ABOUT UCSF The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences.

You’ll help the wider business focus on the most critical user problems and opportunities that we can address – then help discern if the changes we make get the results we want. Our researchers work closely with others in the design team, engineers, and product management. You’ll join a team of 12 specialist design researchers who work within our 50-strong design team that includes product designers and content strategists. We’re spread around the globe, with people based in New Zealand, Australia and the United States. Despite the distance, we’re a tight- knit and collaborative group.  Researcher: Semantic Machines is hiring a few extremely talented researchers and engineers to join our world-class team in Boston, MA and Berkeley, CA. Our team has advanced the state of the art in natural language processing, speech processing, deep learning, video game AI, and even computational historical linguistics. We have built multiple hundred million dollar companies, and created tools and libraries used by thousands of researchers around the globe. We're looking for folks who are smart, passionate, productive, and kind to join in our ambitious project. We are doing incredible work that will reshape research in dialogue systems, and we are committed to sharing that work with the community. You can expect to continue to publish the results of your research if you like. Responsibilities You will be part of an ambitious plan to reshape human-computer interaction with conversational AI. We believe that the current prevailing approaches to dialogue systems are insufficient to carry out a natural, flowing conversation. We are going to fix this. We are working on the entire dialogue “stack:” from speech recognition and analysis to dialogue state management, generation, and speech synthesis. You will work on problems related to data capture, modeling, learning, and decoding within and across the major components of our system. Because our team is small, a desire to tackle problems at every level is a huge plus. Qualifications We are looking for experienced research scientists and top graduate students/post-docs with: experience building large, production-quality NLP, speech, or deep learning systems a track record of publication in top-tier conferences or other evidence of significant contributions to this or a related field is required A PhD is required a proven ability and desire to spin up quickly on new topics and techniques commitment to seeing an idea from conception and prototyping through to deployment and production. strong software engineering and interpersonal skills Tools We're a small group, and want to use the right tools for each project. Experience in the languages & systems we're using is an asset but not a requirement; perhaps you will bring new ideas and help improve the way we work. We are currently writing in Scala/Java, Python, and C++. Our production systems, as well as our research clusters, are deployed on AWS. Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Growth Specialist: With over 240 million users in 196 countries, Change.org is the world’s largest technology platform for social change. Our team spans 18 countries and empowers hundreds of millions of people to have a voice and fight injustice. We’re a social impact business, and we’re aiming to build a world where no one is powerless and where creating change is a part of everyday life. We do everything we can to look after our staff - unlimited vacation (that actually gets used), and 18 weeks parental leave are just the beginning. And best of all, our team is high impact, low ego and incredibly inspiring. About the role: We’re seeking a hands-on and highly motivated Growth Specialist to join our product team. In this role, you’ll be responsible for building, running and analyzing creative experiments across all parts of the Change.org platform. Our approach to growth is largely built around continuous and rapid experimentation. We obsess over iterative optimizations to our user experience, so our product can provide the perfect tools to win campaigns started by our users. As an experimenter you will use your creative problem solving skills to run A/B tests and drive business decisions through reliable and reproducible analyses. This is a unique opportunity to be a part of a growth team that works closely with our product, design, engineering and campaigns teams to drive significant impact for social change. The role is based in either of our San Francisco or Victoria, BC offices. Who we’re looking for: You’re a phenomenal fit for this role if you have a curious mind. You’re not afraid to ask questions and learn new things. As someone with a low ego, you listen to data even when it disproves your own point of view. You’re collaborative and enjoy working with people from diverse backgrounds and you’re able to communicate difficult concepts to others. You will thrive on this team if you are someone who can ask questions, sweat the details, continuously keep learning, and learn from others. What you’ll be doing: Driving impact - you’ll be pushing significant improvements to Change.org’s core growth, impact and revenue metrics through executing a program of rapid, continuous A/B testing such that no traffic is underutilized. Growing the community - Show us your knowledge of the growth hacking best practices. Wow us with ideas and channels we’ve never even considered. Thinking deep and acting quick - ask a lot of questions and think deeply about users, but know that time is of the essence. Generating ideas - on a daily basis you’ll be coming up with creative user assumptions to test and iterating from each previous experiment to develop key user behaviour insights Sweating the numbers - analyzing results and digging into data to understand exactly what’s working and what’s not. Articulate results and lessons simply in order to drive learning and report out improvements across the organisation. Building cross-functional leadership - No one works with more teams than you do. You’ll be working with everyone across our campaigns, operations, engineering, analytics, and design. You know their strengths and how they’ll work with you to bring in more users. You’ll also be working across multiple languages, timezones and cultures. Optimizing user experience - Rapidly execute A/B tests across key parts of the Change.org product that improves performance of the platform. In particular our email, petition creation, share content, sign page and post-sign experience. Understanding our users - You’ll constantly be trying to get inside the heads of the different users of the platform, and you’ll have demonstrated passion and capability for this in the past. Writing and producing content - You love finding exactly the right phrase or word, or finding exactly the right image to capture a concept, inspire action, and motivate. And you should also have the right eye to spot tpyos. It’s great, but not required if you have: Understanding of basic statistical concepts (like Confidence Intervals) and statistical tests for experiments & trials. Experience with SQL, Javascript and HTML/CSS Experience with A/B Testing tools (ie Optimizely, Google Optimize, etc) Experience with product design tools (Illustrator, Sketch, Invision) Interested? Great, here’s what you should know: It’s a role that is based in San Francisco or Victoria, BC. Though we are open to someone starting remotely and moving to one of those places by early Q4 2018. If you would need to relocate for the role, we could assist. Change.org is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage applicants of different backgrounds, cultures, genders, experiences, abilities and perspectives to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical disability, or length of time spent unemployed. We’re working for a world where no one is powerless, and where creating change is a part of everyday life. We’re just getting started, and we hope you’ll join us. Apply for this job

 Implementation Specialist: Join a high-performing, tight-knit team in a fast-growing startup working to make hiring more transparent, collaborative, strategic, and effective. The Customer Success organization at Lever holds deep product and recruiting knowledge and is growing quickly in response to the fast-growing list of Lever customers. As an Implementation Specialist, you will be on the front lines with our customers, understanding their recruiting organizations, learning about their goals, pain points, helping them get up and running on Lever, and guiding them along the way so they can achieve the best possible outcome using Lever. Bringing your 3-5 years of relevant experience to the table, you’ll work alongside our Sales team to ensure a smooth handoff, and take over as the primary point of contact for our customers from initial setup, provisioning, and training through their rollout and adoption of Lever. You’ll train our newest customers in targeted one-on-one sessions help them setup and configure their accounts; prepare and migrate their data; and advise them in the configuration and integration of their job site. We count an implementation as successful when our customer’s account is set up, their team is trained, and they are confident in their use of Lever to meet their recruiting goals. Implementation Specialists are product experts, effective communicators, highly motivated, organized, personable and persuasive. As an Implementation Specialist working with our SMB/Corporate Customers, you will be in a high-volume customer-facing role where you will have complete control of your pipeline providing one-on-one trainings to drive adoption and utilization of the Lever platform. If the words hustle, creativity, and persistence are often associated with you, then we want to hear from you. Our perfect coworker is smart, self-directed, persuasive, empathetic, high- energy, and passionate about helping our customers. It's critical that you are product-savvy and can quickly learn how to use new tools (including Lever). We are looking for someone who knows how to manage their time effectively and can easily prioritize the tasks in front of them. If this sounds like you, drop us a line! WITHIN 1 MONTH, YOU'LL: Jump into the support queue to answer 80% of basic customer questions quickly and efficiently without additional support. Learn pertinent internal tools (Google Apps, Slack, Intercom, Zoom, Salesforce, Zendesk, Lever). Dig into the recruiting world, quickly learning different recruiting team roles, interactions, activities, and metrics and how it all works with Lever. Pick up your first implementation and work, with guidance, to: assess needs, configure their account, train their team, set up their job site and coordinate the import of customer data. WITHIN 3 MONTHS, YOU'LL: Successfully implement accounts in 60 days or less. Be fully ramped up, managing up to 35 concurrent implementations and taking 15 customers live with Lever each month. Be fully versed in Lever tools keeping essential customer data organized and tracking all your interactions with customers. Become a subject matter expert in one aspect of Lever and the related recruiting activities, supporting other Implementation Specialists including building out training materials based on that subject. Create urgency, instill confidence, and provide fantastic customer service as you guide recruiting professionals through the initial setup, provisioning and their early adoption stage of Lever at their company. Successfully transform and import customer data into Lever. WITHIN 6 MONTHS, YOU'LL: Continue to manage a high volume of accounts post-sale, through the implementation process to ensure the successful adoption of Lever. Make emails/calls each day to drive urgency, engagement and utilization. Develop tactics to increase adoption and utilization within your pipeline. Meet and exceed monthly metrics and objectives. Drive conversations with recruiting professionals to identify and document real obstacles hindering their adoption of Lever – your insight will help drive changes and new features and improve future success. Provide input for overall implementation process improvements. Get involved in hiring and growing the team by evaluating/interviewing candidates. Help train new Implementation Specialists. Continuously learn and maintain your expert product knowledge as the Lever platform evolves and grows. Depending on your interest and performance, work with your manager to start progressing towards your next role: one as a Customer Success Manager, a Senior Implementation Specialist or a member of the management team. WITHIN 12 MONTHS, YOU'LL: Mentor new hires and teach best practices to lead the team towards future success. Deepen knowledge of tactics to increase adoption and utilization within your accounts and share across the team. Identify gaps within our processes, propose solutions and execute to continue raising the bar on the team. IS THIS ROLE NOT AN EXACT FIT? Sign up to stay in touch, we’ll let you know when we have new positions on the team. THE LEVER STORY Lever builds modern recruiting software for teams to source, interview, and hire top talent. Our team strives to set a new bar for enterprise software with modern, well-designed, real-time apps. We participated in Y Combinator in summer 2012, and since then have raised $73 million. As the applicant tracking system of choice for Netflix, Eventbrite, ClearSlide, change.org, and thousands more leading companies, Lever means you hire the best by hiring together. Partners with other employees to ensure customers' end-to-end needs are met and that no customer is left unserved or underserved. Utilizes all relevant sales tools to drive profitable growth and exceed department and individual goals. Helps answer questions and resolve customer issues. Job responsibilities include: Flex as coverage between Checkout, Store Pickup and Customer Service as necessary Accountable for driving positive NPS results at Checkout, Store Pickup and Customer Service. Inventory Specialist: What does a Best Buy Inventory Specialist do? At Best Buy our mission is to leverage the unique talents and passions of our employees to inspire, delight, and enrich the lives of our customers through technology and all its possibilities. If you have a passion and curiosity for what is possible and enjoy people, we invite you to join us on this mission. This position is responsible to receive and ship merchandise to/from store and to stock merchandise in the warehouse or on the sales floor. 80% of your time you will: Receive and ship store merchandise: Removes merchandise from truck and compare against packing list. Applies security tag to product and moves it to sales floor or warehouse storage. Packages merchandise for shipment and completes bill of lading for transfers Packages merchandise for shipment to return to Distribution Centers. Operates equipment according to company safety standards to assist in moving merchandise. Stocks merchandise on the sales floor. Assists in the receiving of drop shipments Prepares merchandise for home delivery. Accurately documents movement of merchandise. Completes paperwork for store receiving, transfers, home delivery, DEVO, Junk Out. 10% of your time you will: Provide and maintain store appearance: Ensures clean parking lot, sidewalks, store entry, aisles, restrooms, warehouse area. Properly disposes of debris, boxes. 10% of your time you will: Provides carryout service for customers: Safely loads merchandise in customer’s vehicle. Verifies receipt against merchandise. What are the professional requirements of an Inventory Specialist? Basic Qualifications Ability to work successfully as part of a team Ability to work a flexible schedule inclusive of holidays, nights and weekends Ability to lift or maneuver 50-100 pounds, with or without accommodations Preferred Qualifications 3 months experience in retail, customer service or related fields What are my rewards and benefits? You will be responsible for: Greeting vendors, customers, job applicants and other visitors Scheduling appointments and working with Google Calendar Making room reservations Receiving and distributing mail from FedEx, UPS and USPS Qualifying and forwarding messages from vendors, prospective partners and the general public Executive assistant duties for C-level staff, as needed Keeping the office stocked with supplies Keeping 12 conference rooms tidy and stocked with supplies Working closely with our Impact Team to ensure that we have one of the best places to work Contacting and soliciting bids from outside service providers You should be: Quick learner A self-starter Confident Full-time (9-5, M-F) availability Self-motivated and able to adapt to work well both solo and on a team Requirements: Minimum High School diploma, prefer one year of college or equivalent in related field Preferred 2 years prior general clerical/receptionist experience Detail oriented High attention to etiquette Familiar with Mac, Google Mail and Google Calendar Customer service focus Proven communication and interpersonal skills Ability to prioritize and multitask in a fast-paced environment Why work for Mutual Mobile? We make great products. We craft beautiful mobile interfaces and solve complex software challenges. Clients such as HEB, Google, lynda.com, Citi, Nike, and Under Armour come to us for our deep experience in mobile and emerging technology — from establishing a mobile strategy that provides impactful business value, to building those solutions from the ground up. We bring together the brightest minds in interactive & visual design, engineering, and business management to deliver solutions that actually matter. You’ll love working here, because this isn’t a company of silos. Team members are empowered and encouraged to pursue cool ideas, think for themselves, and make mistakes. If your passion extends beyond the role, we’ll invite your views and assistance with improving our culture, systems and processes. We know you’re smart, and that you love learning new technologies--so you’ll be able to work on a variety of projects with many different types of people.
 Visa University Learning Design and Innovation Manager: Job Description Imagine yourself leading the design of innovative experiences that transform the learning culture of Visa. This is an incredible opportunity to shape some of the most highly visible initiatives inside one of the world’s most valuable brands, including strategic learning programs. About Us: We are a startup within a large global organization. We combine data, subject-matter expertise, intuition and common sense to develop the most effective solutions for the business. We like to prototype, launch and evaluate. We are comfortable learning from our mistakes. About You: Mindset and Attitude You are innovative, agile and care deeply about the learner experience. You are resilient, flexible and view false starts, changing priorities and constructive feedback as opportunities, not setbacks. You have a solutions-oriented approach and find challenges to be an energizing way to flex your creative problem-solving skills. You have a global mindset and are skilled at developing relationships across levels and geographies. Responsibilities: Employ agile development approaches and human-centered design to manage the creation of meaningful and effective learning experiences (including instructor-led, online, mobile, social, microlearning, gaming, and mixed reality). Collaborate with design partners, stakeholders, subject-matter experts and vendors to create and deliver exceptional learning experiences. Seamlessly incorporate recommendations based on evaluation data into the design and maintenance process. Conduct reviews to ensure quality of learning materials, experiences and programs. Curate and create online learning paths. Clearly articulate rationale for learning approaches based on sound learning science, adult learning principles, interoperability standards, web accessibility standards, and human-centered design. Create learning products that boost employee performance and happiness. Qualifications Qualifications Master’s Degree in Instructional Design and Technology, Learning Sciences, Adult Education, other related discipline, or equivalent education and experience. Five-plus years of experience designing innovative learning products for corporate clients. Deep knowledge of instructional design including needs assessment, participant and program evaluation, curriculum design and development. Demonstrated experience with design and development of innovative instructor-led training, eLearning, social learning, microlearning, learning games, virtual/augmented reality, etc. Expertise with effective use of technology in the classroom and the design of synchronous distance learning solutions, including video-conferencing, webinars, etc. Expertise leveraging agile product management principles to lead learning design projects. Ability to create high-impact instructional materials, technical and non-technical reports, presentations, and briefings. Demonstrated ability to influence peers, leaders and key stakeholders. Experience curating content. Proficient leveraging content-authoring tools (e.g. Articulate Storyline). Expertise with Learning Management Systems (LMS). Strong business acumen, analytical and problem-solving skills. Additional Information Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
 Downtown Shops Crew Member: We are on the hunt for fun , welcoming , mindful , and refreshing people who are full of vitality and strive to be exceptional. At JuiceLand we work hard for the best quality, and we laugh while we hustle. We welcome singing and dancing on the job! Where else can you leave work smelling like fruit and veggie freshness? We welcome diversity, we LOVE our customers, and we continuously invent new delicious recipes! We are constantly evolving and above all, we support and respect each other. If you feel like you would thrive in our hashtag fresh environment, then come help us make drinks come true! What will you be doing, you ask? Cashier duties: blowing customers minds with your product knowledge and backing up your coworkers by keeping the store stocked and clean. Food prep: slicing and dicing all those delicious fruits and veggies (Omnom!) Drinkmaking: masterfully crafting our delicious drinks with superhero like speed and accuracy (because you are the superhero to our customers) Working at JuiceLand aint easy all the time, but you will be fully trained for success! You should be prepared to hustle and to be on your feet for your whole shift. Please complete the FULL application, and be ready to give us CLEAR and ACCURATE availability. Compensation: hourly + tips = $12.50 GUARANTEED MINIMUM We also offer some sweet employee perks and programs! Health benefits for full-time employees $10 JuiceLand credit every day you work a shift Discounted Castle Hill membership Fresh4Life - employees can apply to receive $2,000 to put towards their personal goals (3 recipients per year) tribecalledquench Instagram feature - we feature employees who cultivate JuiceLand’s core values in everyday life with a professional photo and a personal quote. You are applying for the DOWNTOWN region, which includes our shops at Barton Springs, Deep Eddy, Cesar Chavez, MLK, Frost, and S. 1st. Qualifications What do you need to lock down this juicy life? A Texas certified Food Handlers License Reliable transportation A positive and customer focused attitude An interest in learning about alternative health, nutrition, and superfoods If you really wanna impress us: a short cover letter explaining why you want to become a JuiceLander Documentation proving you are legally able to work in the U.S. (Photo I.D. + Social Security Card/Birth Certificate OR Passport)
 Asset Protection Associate: What does a Best Buy Asset Protection Associate do? At Best Buy our mission is to leverage the unique talents and passions of our employees to inspire, delight, and enrich the lives our customers through technology and all its possibilities. If you have a passion and curiosity for what is possible and enjoy people, we invite you to join us on this mission. A Best Buy Asset Protection Associate coaches and leads employees in asset protection best practices to ensure a safe, secure and profitable environment throughout the store. They work with the Asset Protection Lead to resolve any hazards or compliance issues and investigate any accidents. They also demonstrate preparedness and exhibit behaviors for proper emergency response procedures. At Best Buy we give you plenty of ways to challenge yourself. You’ll find working in a high-paced retail environment increases your ability to solve problems, multitask and work in a team environment. Further, our leadership is committed to helping you succeed in your current role and prepare you for the next through coaching and performance appraisals. 40% of your time you will: Monitor the store for potential security risks and alarm function. Protect against fraudulent activity by creating AP Alerts and reporting and documenting incidents properly when necessary. 30% of your time you will: Teach and coach store employees about the principles, standards and policies related to safety and crisis events and monitor their fulfillment. Work with the Asset Protection Lead and others to resolve any hazards or compliance issues and investigate any employee or customer accidents. 30% of your time you will: Interact with customers and store employees to maintain a safe and profitable environment. What are the Professional Requirements of a Best Buy Asset Protection Associate? Basic Qualifications Ability to work successfully as part of a team Ability to work a flexible schedule inclusive of holidays, nights and weekends Ability to lift or maneuver 50-100 pounds, with or without accommodations Preferred Qualifications 3 months experience in retail, customer service or related fields What are my rewards and benefits? Discover your career here! At Best Buy we offer much more than a paycheck. Surrounded by the latest and greatest technology, a team of amazing coworkers and a work environment where anything is possible, you’ll find it easy to be your best when you work with us. We provide an exciting work environment with a community of techno learners where you can be yourself while investing in your career. Empowered with knowledge you will discover endless opportunities to grow. From deep employee discounts to tuition reimbursement, to health, wealth and wellness benefits, to learning and development programs, we believe the success of our company depends on the passion of employees for learning, technology and people.

Customer Service Specialist: What does a Best Buy Customer Service Specialist do? The Best Buy Customer Service Specialist provides fast, accurate and friendly processing for all customer transactions at Checkout, Customer Service and Store Pickup while providing velocity solutions to customers. Develops strong relationships with customers while becoming a trusted advisor and partner in assisting them in making technology more functional in their lives. Partners with other employees to ensure customers' end-to-end needs are met and that no customer is left unserved or underserved. Utilizes all relevant sales tools to drive profitable growth and exceed department and individual goals. Helps answer questions and resolve customer issues. Job responsibilities include: Flex as coverage between Checkout, Store Pickup and Customer Service as necessary Accountable for driving positive NPS results at Checkout, Store Pickup and Customer Service. Maintain professional communication with customers and peers while using cross-functional company resources and tools. Engage customers using soft skills while solving issues, providing end-to-end solutions with fast and accurate processing of transactions. Ensure Front of Store cleanliness and merchandising standard execution. What are the Professional Requirements of a Best Buy Customer Service Specialist?  Procurement Specialist: Procurement Specialist Requisition ID: 1706501 Description Position Summary As a Procurement Specialist you will use your ability to develop supplier relationships, creativity and problem solving skills to ensure a timely and high-quality supply of materials into our ISO9001:2008-certified Cedar Park, TX facility. You will accomplish this by collaborating with your Materials peers, several engineering communities (applications, manufacturing, sustaining, intercompany, software), and the supply chain community (planning, order fulfillment, manufacturing) to understand supply problems, identify root causes, and drive implementation of solutions. Keys to Hiring The best Procurement Specialists are able to proactively monitor supplier performance and identify problems, define solutions, and optimize quality, reliability, price, delivery, and availability. They possess a good balance of hands-on technical competency, particularly with ERP systems, coupled with the ability to learn and apply new knowledge about our people, products, and processes in resolving problems. They are comfortable with addressing a wide variety problems, seeking to understand the problem thoroughly before suggesting changes or solutions. The best Procurement Specialist’s skills are evident through past problems solved and the implementation of new methods and systems with measurable results. Prioritization and managing numerous suppliers (10-25) and hundreds of products is an essential aspect of good Procurement Specialists. You will own a mix of standard off-the-shelf and custom, application-specific electrical and mechanical products supplied by established distributors and specialty manufacturers. You are comfortable with identifying and establishing sources of supply for new products, as well as finding alternatives for obsolete, discontinued or single sourced items. Performance Objectives Primary Objective : The most important performance objective for this position is to establish and own the on time delivery, lead time, quality, and cost of the products in your area of responsibility. Secondary Objective : During the first 90 days, you will focus on gaining in-depth knowledge of our ERP system (JD Edwards, JDE) as well as our engineering document system (Teamcenter). This knowledge will be crucial to your ability to perform daily and to identify and drive future improvements. Role Navigation within Cedar Park : During the first 30 days, you will meet all key stakeholders within Cedar Park Materials, and spend time with the Manufacturing Engineers, Planners, Order Management, and Warehouse/Shipping/Receiving to learn the processes of each group. Along the way you will note the problems they currently observe. Technical Competencies : First 30 days: Meet and get to know your fellow Materials team members. Obtain and learn basic reporting and information gathering skills in Teamcenter and JDE ERP. Begin processing JDE ERP-generated purchase requisitions. Begin processing Item Attribute Reviews (IARs, creating or updating purchased part parameters in JDE). Begin meeting and interacting with your suppliers. You will be the primary contact for your group of suppliers. Begin utilizing standard purchasing maintenance and communication tools as part of the supply chain management process: o Learn to use the Sales Order Shortage Report to identify and initiate critical SO reschedule activity. o Learn to use system generated exception reports to identify and initiate vendor follow-up and maintenance activity. Next 90 days: Get to know your peers in the Focused Factories and in Scheduling, Order Fulfillment, Engineering, and Quality Gain deep understanding of the performance of your suppliers. Learn about and begin seeking improvements in supplier performance. Seek improvement in your own performance (aging requisitions, amount of goods in MRB, open PO’s needing review, etc.). Develop deep understanding of your products and their applications. At 120 days and beyond: Begin making changes based on the learning derived from the first 6 months, working closely with your Materials peers. Monitor your supplier key performance indicators (KPI’s) for evidence of positive change. Receive feedback as you execute the Plan, Do, Check, Act cycle. Drive for excellence in results with your group of suppliers. Qualifications Address major problems, changes, and improvements : Some critical problems to solve and necessary improvements within the Procurement department involve Item Attribute maintenance, workload balance, and controlling and reversing growth of purchased part inventories. You will begin by reviewing key item parameters (lot size, lead time, source of supply, dangerous goods classification). You will also review quality issues by participating in the Material Review Board (MRB) process, initiate returns/credits with suppliers as appropriate, and work with Quality team peers to identify root cause and countermeasures to address those issues. You will understand the balance between cost, quantities, delivery frequency, lead time, and inventory turns, and seek to optimize these competing factors. Effective collaboration with Master Scheduling, Planners, and recognized ERP system experts will be critical to successfully managing these factors. In the future, you will continue solving a wide range of problems that tie back to our safety, quality, delivery, cost, and innovation goals. Along the way, you will develop a broad understanding of how we create value, as well as deep knowledge of specific people, processes, and products. Each learning cycle will build upon and complement your past experience. This will be evidenced by your successful management of your suppliers. Thinking Skills and Decision Making: A good Procurement Specialist has the ability to identify problems, think tactically/technically, solve problems and implement solutions. You will always seek to deeply understand why the current state exists (why certain parts were selected, etc.). You recognize there are many ways to solve problems, and you address well-defined and poorly-defined problems by selecting the appropriate problem solving schema. You will work independently, but with constant interaction with your peers. You demonstrate fact-based decision making, and expect the same from others. Personality and Interpersonal Skills: You are an advocate for NOV in working with our suppliers. You demonstrate the willingness and ability to solve problems in an office setting as well as on the shop floor. You understand that people, processes, and products are deeply intertwined, and you understand the importance of all three. You exhibit a “won’t take no for an answer” attitude, and have the ability to regroup and attack the problem in a different manner if faced with a “no”. You will learn and apply structured conflict resolution methods to maintain a smooth supply of materials with minimal disruptions. You successfully balance patience while understanding a problem or process, with urgency while driving improvements. You act as a defender, supporter, and advocate for NOV in supplier price and delivery negotiations. You enjoy being a subject matter expert, and believe continuous learning is an essential part of who you are. You are accomplishment-oriented, and gain satisfaction from learning by doing. Additional Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in relevant field Supply chain experience (min 5 yrs.) as a buyer, procurement specialist, or purchasing coordinator. Comprehensive understanding of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, supply chain theory and concepts, and Excel. JDE experience is a plus. Lean manufacturing knowledge is a plus. Strong communicator with the ability to negotiate effectively with vendors. Strong analytical skills; comfortable assessing supply chain inventory and cost scenarios. Strong desire to share best practices with peers Impeccable attention to detail. Strong desire to learn, seek improvement, and tackle the most impactful supply chain challenges. Strong team player with the ability to effectively work and communicate with peers in Quality, Purchasing, Planning, Manufacturing, Sales, Engineering, and other functional areas. Ability to thrive in a fast paced, dynamic business environment. APICS or other supply chain certification is a plus. Job : Purchasing Schedule : Full-time Shift : Day Job Job Posting :
