 Technology Early Career Development Program (TECDP) Co-Op: Do you have a passion for technology? Cigna IT is looking for passionate technology-focused Co- op students to join the Technology Early Career Development Program (TECDP). The mission of the TECDP is to support the professional development needs of associates and talent requirements of Cigna IT by providing challenging assignments, structured training, and mentoring through a committed partnership between individual associates, program management and the IT organization. TECDP Co-ops will begin to shape their career path through their professional experiences with program support and discussions with mentors, TECDP buddies, peers, and co-workers. TECDP offers structured technical and non-technical training, networking opportunities, formal mentoring, and exposure to a breadth of technology across multiple lines of business. Throughout the 6 months, TECDP co-ops will be challenged to develop the skills and competencies necessary to become a successful IT professional. To help develop these skills, TECDP co-ops will participate in a group project during their time at Cigna. Fall/Winter co-ops complete a research project which generally evaluates a technology used within Cigna or proposes a new technology or change to our environment. Spring/Summer co-ops (along with interns located in AZ, CO, CT, MN, PA, TN) contribute to an innovation development project within the health services field. Spring/Summer co-ops may also have the opportunity to take a short trip up to our headquarters in Bloomfield, CT for the project orientation and final presentation. At the conclusion of the co-op, your hard work and achievements will be celebrated with an off-boarding event at a location determined by your co- op experience lead! Many of Cigna co-op associates pipeline into full-time employment upon graduation. These individuals have the opportunity to join the technical track or the rotational track. The rotational track focuses on broad-based development, providing associates with a total of three unique rotations, each approximately 12 to 18 months in length, giving diverse knowledge of Cigna IT. Rotational assignments include a variety of IT positions. The technical track focuses on deep development in a technology function or specific area of IT with increasing the complexity and scope of the role while in the program. Technical assignments are typically focused in application development or infrastructure areas. Full-time associates also have the potential to do an international assignment in Europe or Asia. Co-op Opportunities (include but are not limited to) • Application Developer - designs, codes, tests, and documents programs • Infrastructure Engineer – provide operational support for IT application test lab, including building and supporting server test hardware and software for application developers to test applications • Production Support - supports IT systems and application currently in production and resolves end-user incidents • Quality Assurance Analyst - tests new or modified applications • Business Analyst - formulates and defines system scope and objectives based on customer requirements and business need • Systems Analyst - works with business partner to identify and illustrate application requirements and turn them into detailed specifications • Project Manager - responsible for leading, planning, managing, and directing teams to accomplish specific objectives within defined constraints • Information Protection Specialist - responsible for supporting IT security measures • Architecture Specialist - creates standards and opportunities for reuse across IT to reduce cost and complexity. Assists with initial application design for fit and alignment Qualifications Preferred Qualifications: •Bachelor’s Degree in progress in Information Science & Technology, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Mathematics, Computer Engineering or Business related disciplines •Ability to effectively communicate via oral and written channels •Team player with strong interpersonal skills •Excellent analytical/technical skills and knowledge •Innovative thinker and problem solver •Energetic, motivated and career-driven •Seeks learning opportunities •3.0 or better overall GPA US Candidates Only : Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status. If you require a special accommodation, please visit our Careers website or contact us at SeeYourself@cigna.com . Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status. Need an accommodation? Email: SeeYourself@cigna.com
Director of Customer Experience: Insomnia Cookies was founded in a college dorm room in 2003 at the University of Pennsylvania, by then student, Seth Berkowitz and we have been feeding the insatiable hunger of our fans ever since. What makes us so great? We specialize in delivering warm, delicious cookies right to the doors of individuals and companies alike - What's not to love? Today we have more than 138 locations and are still growing! Whether you're feeding a craving or a crowd, our offerings of cookies, brownies, cookie cakes and even cold milk have you covered. We also serve and deliver ice cream at most of our locations. - For real! The very best teams need great leadership. Insomnia Cookies is hiring a Director of Customer Experience for our National Customer Service Center. As a Director of Customer Experience, it's your role to lead our team to deliver an outstanding customer experience for each and every one of our guests. The Director of Customer Experience will be responsible for effective operations and continuous process improvement with a focus on call center technology advancements and by providing leadership, direction and motivation to the workforce. Driving sales is a key component. Responsibilities Research, develop, test and rollout new call center technology system improvements. The goals are to become more effective, efficient and deliver a best in class customer experience. Oversee training personnel in development and execution of education programs for Self, Managers, Supervisors, Leads and Customer Service Representatives. This includes new hires as well as ongoing training. Must create an environment of learning. Oversee sourcing and hiring of top talent for all positions within our Customer Experience Team. Manage efficiency by staffing customer service to meet the fluctuations in customer demand. Identify and implement technology to achieve this goal and be constantly planning for upward scaling of team. Providing clear, accurate and timely communication to staff and leadership Ability to bring out the best performance in the workforce through employee engagement and an inclusive working environment Oversee and continuously improve quality assurance program. Research and implement technology that will positively impact quality assurance. Take incoming calls as needed and display professional, courteous demeanor when handling guest calls. Provide prompt and outstanding service to all guest inquiries. Answer questions/educate guests and customer service representatives on products and company policies. Set, communicate and monitor strategic goals of department Complete annual budgeting process, monitor through the course of the year and take appropriate action quickly where needed. Hold regular sales meetings focused on sales progress, sales opportunities and growth, competitive issues and ongoing training. Motivate the Inside Sales team to achieve individual team member goals. Research and incorporate technology to drive best sales results. Be present on call center floor and observe Managers, Supervisors, Leads and Customer Service Representatives by interacting on calls and coaching Review and request reports in order to analyze data and search for patterns and opportunities Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned from the VP Support Center and COO Requirements MUST have proven track record of developing, testing and implementing technology advancements in the call center environment. This includes tools such as IVR, Chat, Customer Surveys and other new software/contact center technological advancements. A dynamic change agent who is committed to continuous process improvement. Deep network of contacts and vendor companies within the call center industry. Ability to organize, prioritize workload, meet deadlines, and deliver results in a fast-paced and quickly expanding environment with minimal supervision. Must have exceptional follow through. Proven track record of self and team development. Both in soft and technical skills. Track record of driving sales both internally and externally. Formal sales training preferred. Demonstrated proficiency in the development of comprehensive reports. This includes the ability to collect, interpret, and present data, and reach effective decisions using such data. Three plus years Leadership/Management experience in a call center environment with a team of at least 100 Bachelor's degree preferred Ability to exercise sound judgment and to react with discretion under varying conditions Ability to maintain professionalism and use tact to resolve conflicts Must be able to work a varying schedule with emphasis on evening and weekend hours. Our hours are 22 hours a day 7 days a week. Please note that if you are unable to work varying schedules or cannot work on certain days this position will not be a good fit for you.
 NMCI/RDT&E Seat Representative: EOE Statement We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Category Information Technology Description Description: Effective management of the Cyber Security (CS) program throughout the Organization is critical to ensuring compliance with cyber security policies and the maintenance of acceptable levels of cyber security risk. The IT Coordinator role is to maintain cognizance over the information technology (IT) and CS support activities. As an embedded resource, ITC is responsible to promote the learning, understanding, and knowledge of unique environments within each technical Organization. This deep understanding of a technical Organization's mission and capabilities enables the IT/CS support personnel to provide tailored solutions in the areas for which they maintain cognizance, while still ensuring that all efforts align with the Organization requirements and policies established by higher authority. ITC duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to: a. Act as a single point of contact for the Organization leadership on all IT/CS concerns. b. Advocate on behalf of the assigned Organization when participating in Division policy and procedure development. c. Develop strategic planning initiatives within the Organization for the delivery of IT/CS solutions and contribute to the Division strategic planning initiatives. d. Manage, track, and ensure compliance with annual CS Awareness Training within the Organization. e. Determine requirements for, and review, IT security exception requests. f. Maintain access to SIPRNET resources and check regularly for CTOs and CS Program announcements. g. Respond for the Organization to data calls associated with IT/CS program elements and/or the CSWF. h. Ensure audit readiness and execute activities necessary to prepare for Organization inspections of the IT/CS program. i. Coordinate with the Organization Information Assurance Officer (lAO) and NMCI Seat Rep to prepare and deliver status reports to the Department Heads, ISSM, and ACIO. Educational/Experience Requirements: Minimum of IAT Level II Certification (Microsoft Server and CompTia Sec + certifications) A minimum of 3 years' experience required. Must be a US citizen with the ability to obtain a Security Clearance. EHS Technologies Corporation is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.  Chief Human Resources Officer: Overview Jazz Pharmaceuticals is an international biopharmaceutical company focused on improving patients’ lives by identifying, developing and commercializing meaningful products that address unmet medical needs. We are continuing to expand our commercial product portfolio and our research and development pipeline in therapeutic areas that can leverage our unique expertise. Our therapeutic areas of focus include sleep and hematology/oncology – areas in which we have a deep understanding of the patient journey and a suite of products and product candidates to address critical needs. We are looking for the best and brightest talent to join our team. If you’re looking to be a part of a company with an unwavering commitment to improving patients’ lives and being a great place to work, we hope you’ll explore our career openings and get to know Jazz Pharmaceuticals. Position Profile Jazz Pharmaceuticals, a global biopharmaceutical company, was founded in 2003. Headquartered in Dublin, Ireland, our main offices are in Palo Alto, CA, Philadelphia, PA, Dublin, Ireland and Oxford, UK. We focus on improving patients’ lives by identifying, developing and commercializing meaningful products that address unmet medical needs. We are driven by one simple motivator: a genuine desire to improve patients’ lives. This is a universal truth across the entire organization, no matter the location, therapeutic focus, discipline or level of the individual. Since its creation, Jazz Pharmaceuticals has experienced strong corporate growth, and continues to build upon a dedicated development team, a focused commercial team and a seasoned management team, all working together for the betterment of patients. Our strategy is to create shareholder value by: Growing sales of the existing products in our portfolio, including by identifying new growth opportunities. Acquiring additional differentiated products that are on the market or product candidates that are in late stage development, and pursuing focused development of a pipeline of post discovery differentiated product candidates. Expecting to continue to grow both organically and through acquisitions, and other business development opportunities in the foreseeable future. Brief Description: Further Jazz’s mission to improve patients’ lives while making the company a great place to work! Lead development and execution of the global Human Capital strategy to drive and deliver on prioritized business results in line with the company’s strategy, goals, and values. In addition to leading the Human Resources function, also helps lead across the organization as a member of the company’s Executive Committee, serves as Chair of Total Rewards Committee, and is an active participant in Company’s Board of Director’s Compensation Committee. Reports to the Chairman and CEO. Essential Functions In collaboration with the CEO, other members of the Executive Committee (EC), and the senior Human Resources (HR) team, develops the global long- and short-term Human Capital strategy and goals for the company. Leads, directs and coaches an effective, respected and strong, global team of regular employees, contractors and RPO. Leads team on execution of the Human Capital strategy and prioritized goals to drive business success in line with Jazz’s overall mission, strategy, goals, and values Direct reports include Heads of: Talent Management (Talent Acquisition, Employee Engagement & Communication and Learning & Development), Compensation and Benefits, HR Business Partners, and HR Operations. Oversees the company’s HR programs, including Work Force Planning (includes talent mapping, succession planning and organizational development and design), Change Management initiatives, Total Rewards initiatives (“right” interplay of compensation, benefits and workplace culture), executive and other corporate compensation and benefit plans, Talent Acquisition programs, Management and Leadership development and Mergers and Acquisition projects Participates in and supports the development of the company’s short- and long-term strategies and programs. Oversees, from a human resource perspective, the evaluation and integration of mergers/acquisitions as part of Jazz’s overall growth strategy. Leads across the company, establishing relationships at all levels, as member of the EC and Diversity and Inclusion Oversight Committee, and as the Head of global HR; champion of Jazz’s culture (mission and values) at all times. Provides insight and guidance to CEO, and leaders and managers regarding Human Capital and Organizational Development & Design issues; confidant of CEO and others on the EC Oversees development of policies, programs and communications for effective management of people, change and other human capital issues in compliance with laws and regulations; works closely with internal employment counsel and others in the Legal & Compliance, Finance, IT and Facilities departments. Oversees preparation for and active participant in Board of Director Compensation Committee Meetings Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Significant (20+ years) successful global experience in leading cross-functional HR teams or combination of business/HR leadership with the last several years in HR; to drive business initiatives in line with values-oriented corporate culture Passion for patients and modeling of Jazz values; champion of company values and diversity and inclusion Business acumen and understanding of ways business strategies affect the workplace and culture (company culture and separate geographic cultures); cross-functional business understanding with P&L; orientation Ability to analyze situations and think critically (including consideration of risk, reward, potential outcomes) based on knowledge, insights, data, and determining what is best for the company, patients and employees on a longer-term basis Continual learner and ability to stay abreast of external factors (opportunities and threats) affecting the workplace; uses research, networking, experience and internal/external data to drive the right decisions for the company in line with company’s strategy, goals, mission and values Acumen to balance resources and understand the financial implications and tradeoffs in every aspect of the business including talent and systems; ability to assess growth and development of the company and analyze data and desired outcomes to determine appropriate prioritized investments for the future Ability to influence and lead across the company as a member of a senior management team; develop strong working relationships with diverse team of senior level team members Experience successfully managing significant change initiatives that drive business initiatives Timely quality decision making (mixture of analysis, wisdom, experience, and judgment); Plant Operator - Carneys Point: NAES Corporation has an immediate opening for a Plant Operator at the Carneys Point 262 MW pulverized coal-fired cogeneration facility located within the grounds of the DuPont Chambers Works, an industrial complex in Carneys Point, NJ. About NAES: We are an independent services company dedicated to delivering value to facilities across the power generation, oil & gas, petrochemical, pulp & paper, and manufacturing industries. For more than 35 years, we have drawn on our deep experience in advisory, operations, maintenance, fabrication, construction, engineering, compliance, technical support, asset management and energy management services to assess, build, operate and maintain sites that run safely, reliably and cost-effectively. We operate more than 150 power plants throughout the United States, Canada and Mexico that span all technologies and provide over 41 GW of capacity. With the strength of 4000 people, our growing family of companies now addresses the entire life cycle of power generation and other industrial plants. NAES offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits package (including retirement) and promotional opportunities. The Plant Operator has the primary responsibility of directly operating plant equipment at its location within the plant in a safe, reliable and efficient manner and in full compliance with all applicable laws, regulations, policies and procedures. He or she records operational data and reports any abnormalities. He or she may also perform routine maintenance on equipment and power plant systems, and ensures their safe, proper, and efficient operation. PRIMARY FUNCTIONS Starts, stops, regulates, monitors and controls boilers, turbine generators, and all auxiliary equipment, usually using controls located directly on the equipment. Observes, records and interprets indications from instrumentation and control systems located directly on power plant systems. Assists in the investigation of plant problems, incidents, accidents, and unusual events and provides analyses, recommendations, reports and appropriate follow-up plans. Determines the need for, and performs routine operational tests and adjustments on, all power plant systems and components, as necessary. Checks daily consumption rates of chemicals, fuels and water, monitors supply inventories and initiates action to replenish them when appropriate. Performs equipment switching and hold order tagging. Writes, reviews and revises operating and related procedures. Performs routine basic preventive and predictive maintenance on all systems and equipment and supports corrective maintenance efforts on selected equipment when properly trained or supervised. Maintains logs, records, and data sheets; prepares reports and other administrative documents related to the business of steam and power production. Performs routine water chemistry testing during off-hours. Displays professional behavior at all times. SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY Requires knowledge of own assignments and eventually others in the department, as well as, that of company structure and operations. Should possess an understanding of the departmental goals and activities. Perform other duties as required by plant conditions. NAES SAFE Safety is a core value of NAES and as a condition of employment, all employees are expected to be mentally alert and work safely at all times. Additionally, employees are required to adhere to all safety warnings and posted safety signs whenever on company property. Furthermore, employees must follow all NAES safety rules and procedures. Effectiveness in carrying out this responsibility is part of the evaluation of each and every employee’s performance. WORKING RELATIONSHIPS The Plant Operator reports to the Shift Supervisor and provides work direction to Assistant Plant Operators. The Plant Operator may also give direction to maintenance personnel on matters pertaining to plant operations. PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORKING CONDITIONS Physical requirements include standing on feet for extended periods, requiring stair and ladder climbing and routinely lifting up to 50 pounds. Protective equipment must be worn in the performance of some duties (e.g. hard hats, safety glasses, air masks, ear protection, chemical suits, hot gloves and high voltage protective equipment, etc.). Work with hazardous materials may be required. Position requires extended working hours and varied shifts with weekend and holiday work, as required by schedules, work load and plant conditions. "On call" status will periodically be required. All employees will participate in the Fitness for Duty Program. This program includes a post-offer physical examination and drug screening and post employment random drug screening. There are extensive smoking restrictions in and around the facility. JOB QUALIFICATIONS Ability to read and write in English and perform basic mathematical computations; high school or vocational school diploma preferred Three years of experience in an industrial or military environment Knowledge of power plant equipment, such as motors, pumps, boilers, fluid systems, chemical handling, water treatment systems, cooling towers, pollution control equipment, AC and DC electrical distribution and control systems, etc. Basic knowledge/ability to understand fundamental principles of physics, mathematics, AC and DC electrical theory, heat transfer and fluid flow, thermodynamics and chemistry Ability to read and comprehend mechanical and electrical drawings, P&IDs, single line diagrams, schematics and logic diagrams. Knowledge of power plant safety procedures, especially in such areas as chemical handling, high energy systems, confined spaces, incipient fire suppression, first aid, rotating machinery, heavy equipment operation, etc. Knowledge of maintenance functions as they relate to plant operations Knowledge of power plant systems Ability to operate valves, switches, controls, keyboards and other devices associated with power plant and material handling equipment Ability to use basic hand tools, portable electric and pneumatic tools, basic rigging such as winches, hoists and slings and implements such as lances, shovels, pry bars, etc. Ability to understand an apply plant procedures Ability to recognize hazards, anticipate accidents and implement corrective measures and policies in order to avoid them Ability to work rotating shift work, including days, nights, Holidays and unscheduled overtime as needed Computer proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint applications), GP Learning Module, and CMMS MP2 Module. Valid driver’s license. It is the practice of NAES to seek employees of the highest quality and to select the individuals on the basis of merit and competence, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, military status or affiliation protected under USERRA, or any other basis of discrimination prohibited by applicable local, state and federal law.
 Claims & Benefits Specialist: Company Description Accolade at a glance… Accolade is a personalized health and benefits solution that dramatically improves the experience, outcomes and cost of healthcare for employers, health plans and their members. With a unique blend of compassionate advisors, clinical experts and intelligent technologies, we engage individuals and families in their health, establish trust, and influence their decisions at every stage of care. Accolade connects the widest array of personal health data and programs to present a single point of contact to the most effective health and benefits resources, while coordinating with providers at every step. Accolade consistently achieves 70 and higher Net Promoter Scores, 98% consumer satisfaction ratings, and up to 15% employer cost savings. Accolade has been recognized as one of the nation’s 25 most promising companies by Forbes, a fastest-growing private healthcare company by Inc. 5000, and is consistently rated a Top Workplace across the country. For more information, visit accolade.com. Job Description Role overview The Claims and Benefit Specialist you will work to provide Accolade Health Assistants (AHAs) accurate and timely resolution to their clients’ problems while coaching AHAs and improving their claims and coverage knowledge. In addition, you will continuously evaluate trends, content and processes and make recommendations to fix or improve them. This job requires deep claims and benefit knowledge, critical thinking, creative problem solving, the consistent application of discretion and good judgment, a high degree of organization, the ability to multi-task, and the ability to develop strong health plan partner relationships. A day in the life… Act as a trusted resource for complex claims and benefit questions and issue resolution. Act as a liaison to our health plan partners and providers in solving complex claims and benefit issues. Educate AHAs by helping them better understand claims and benefit questions/issue resolution, and support ongoing training/learning with the Health Assistant Center (HAC). Collaborate with Accolade teammates, health plans, and providers to deliver the best possible service experience for Accolade clients. Handle claim disputes with partner health plans on behalf of the client Ensure compliance with internal and external health plan partner business processes. Develop and maintain solid working relationships and processes with health plans and other payors. Support AHAs with eligibility, benefits, and claims questions and/or issue resolution, including understanding the root cause of the issue Handle claims disputes with partner health plans on behalf of the client. Handle claim disputes with partner health plans on behalf of the client Listen, assess, and comprehend the clients’ presenting issue(s) and use critical thinking, judgment, and problem solving to take appropriate action. Identify opportunities to improve how we resolve claims and benefit issues, including improvements to MRM (our customized service platform), our benefit content, and other tools and resources. Leveraging your industry knowledge and influencing skills, encourage future collaboration with health plans and providers. Participate in special projects as requested Provide colleagues with timely and accurate solutions to their client’s complex claims problems. Effectively manage an ongoing portfolio of claims/benefits issues, ensuring timely, complete and accurate resolution in support of client expectations and health plan processing guidelines. Qualifications What we are looking for… A thorough understanding of health care delivery and previous experience with medical benefits (primarily self-insured plans) and claims from either provider or payor perspective. Health Plan or third party payor claims processing experience with strong technical skills (business expertise) and knowledge of various lines of business and applicable coding (CPT, HCPCS, ICD-9/10, DRG, etc.) Health Plan business/benefit analyst with an emphasis on claims coding (see above line) and benefit set-up Health Plan claims quality assurance Practice Management or Hospital –Familiar with all bill types and national account billing Engage others by being a good listener with a solid capacity for empathy. Possess excellent communication skills and the ability to convey passion and enthusiasm. Possess superior ingenuity, judgment and problem solving skills. Partner/work with teammates to solve issues for clients. Organized, dependable and meticulous. Flexible with a high tolerance for ambiguity. The ability for self-reflection and the capacity to accept and implement feedback. Must be computer literate at an intermediate or advanced level. Must display honesty and integrity. Must be comfortable working in a telephonic environment with clients, health plans, and providers. Additional Information What is important to us Creating an enduring company that is hyper-focused on our culture and making a meaningful impact in the lives of our employees, members and customers. The secret to our success is: We find joy and purpose in serving others Making a difference in our members’ and customers’ lives is what we do. Even when it’s hard, we do the right thing for the right reasons. We are strong individually and together, we’re powerful Trusting in our colleagues and embracing their different backgrounds and experiences enable us to solve tough problems in creative ways, having fun along the way. We roll up our sleeves and get stuff done Results motivate us. And we aren't afraid of the hard work or tough decisions needed to get us there. We’re boldly and relentlessly reinventing healthcare We're curious and act big - not afraid to knock down barriers or take calculated risks to change the world, one person at a time.

The Best Buy Sales Consultant engages customers by utilizing selling skills to build the right solutions for our customers. Chief Customer Officer: The Customer Center of Excellence Leader is a company-wide catalyst to recognize and promote excellence in customer experience while driving continuous improvement. Inspires and influences change…from the front line to executive leadership. This leader builds a differentiated customer experience that brings to life the company’s brand promise and Vison, Values and Mission. This executive-level role is accountable for delivering a customer experience aligned to the brand and values of the company by developing and driving the customer experience vision throughout the organization, through customer engagement, support, customer success, learning, knowledge management, online community, and client relationship management. Demonstrating a customer- obsessed mentality, this leader engages the organization in managing customer relationships, recurring revenue, and profit. It creates a persistent focus on the customer in the actions the company takes globally for on-premise, Cloud, on-demand and other offerings. This role drives the organization to work together for optimum customer experience delivery, steers customer-led innovation, engagement, advocacy and intimacy, and leads customer learning, knowledge management and online community offerings. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Leads the transformation of the culture ensuring that the customer is at the center of all decisions. Drives positive customer experiences that create client value and satisfaction (external and internal), retention and growth, building on voice of the customer feedback, and qualitative and quantitative data. Clarifies a common approach and process for driving operational efficiency across the customer lifecycle, and the work across the organization Champions and leverages sources such as voice of customer insights and analytics, emotional and behavioral research, and customer journey mapping, to fully understand our customers’ experience with us, while focusing daily on delivering value to the company, solving customer experience problems and realistically developing new opportunities. Provides oversight to client relationship management, customer success, online communities, knowledge management and customer education, ensuring post-sale contact with clients maximize client retention and assist clients in the use of the organization's products and/or services. Encourages and works closely with Sales to understand technical and business challenges of the client. Ensures that team understands how to provide the highest level of service and increase value for customers. Establishes metrics for defining the relationship with customers, to manage global customers as an asset and oversight of a united platform for understanding and taking action. Influences cross-company agreement on how to deliver greatest value and best experience to customers in partnership with leaders, drives customer accountability through cross-company data and metrics Oversees, and if required engages in, escalated client issues. Accountable for and ensures customer and partner satisfaction. Leads a team while working collaboratively with other departments, including but not limited to Product Management, Marketing, Finance, Software Development, Account Services, Sales and Consulting to drive customer success. Oversees the identification of opportunities to increase sales of products and/or services and analyze competitor activities to assess any threats to important clients. Oversees the organization's knowledge management and customer education programs. Ensures customer and associated employee training programs are developed that maximize product satisfaction and company revenues. Continually identify evolving customer needs, wants and the priorities customers place on them to help the organization continue to win today and stay ahead of the competition. Leverages customer data as an asset to provide leading insights into client and employee activities, performance and insights where applicable. Maintain a deep knowledge of client industry, product, and role in the market. Lead or participate in other projects or duties. Travel required. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: Coach employees on career development opportunities and strategies. Manage and coach employees on all human resource related processes including: selection, performance management, employee relations, terminations, compensation and rewards, employee development, etc. Recognize others’ contributions and share credit for success. Own attainment of high employee satisfaction and retention; lead development of program and initiatives within group to attain high employee satisfaction. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Demonstrate leadership skills and the ability to influence at all levels within the organization. Ability to establish and drive a “customer obsessed or customer first” culture among leaders and staff. Ability to affect and drive organizational change in particular as it relates to customer culture. Ability to establish clear outcomes aligned with strategy, manage to them, and effectively report on progress. Ability to manage multiple complex, high visibility or high impact projects simultaneously. Ability to facilitate consensus when confronted with strong opposing views. Excellent organizational and communication (oral, written, presentation and facilitation) skills. Must possess strong EQ skills and exhibit emotional stability and maturity in the face of highly emotional and stressful situations. Must be able to successfully interact with and influence executives and non-executives. Must be results oriented, customer focused and able to manage multiple high-visibility or high-impact projects simultaneously. Ability to apply broad expertise or unique knowledge and professional concepts to develop resolutions to critical issues. Ability to create formal networks with key decision makers. Ability to listen and understand information and communicate the same. Ability to work without supervision. Complete latitude for decision making. Proficiency in Microsoft Office packages. Sufficient knowledge of business communication, including telephone, voicemail, and e-mail and operations of office machines, such as photocopier, scanner, and fax. Master’s degree in Business or Computer Science a plus. 15+ years’ experience within the software application development environment, with a minimum of 7-10 years supervisory and leadership experience and 5+ years management responsibility over customer engagement, support, learning, knowledge management, customer success, digital community, and/or client relationship management. Learning Tools Strategist: Description At Pearson, we’re committed to a world that’s always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. From bringing lectures vividly to life to turning textbooks into laptop lessons, we are always re-examining the way people learn best, whether it’s one child in our own backyard or an education community across the globe. We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explore new frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires us to always be better. By pushing the boundaries of technology — and each other to surpass these boundaries — we create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for the world’s innovations, personal and global, large and small. As a Learning Tool Strategist, you’ll join the larger Pearson Courseware team. You will play a critical role in championing the vision for new tools and enhancements to existing tools, which you will then collaborate to bring to life across global education. To be successful, you’ll need to build deep relationships and work across the fast-paced world of Pearson and education technology. Responsibilities: \+ Works closely with Portfolio management, Marketing, and other teams to conduct discipline-specific market research to gather customer & learner needs, inform & propose new product features and content, and determine demand for current and future learning tools, products, & product models. \+ Engages directly with customers & customer-facing teams to understand customer use cases and workflows and anticipate learning tool consumption across product lifecycle & product models. Builds strong relationships with Pearson experts, customers, & thought leaders to inform, validate, and refine new learning tools, content, and associated products. \+ Collaborates with cross-functional teams (UX, Learning Design, and others) to develop product-appropriate design & content strategies while applying customer-informed curriculum and pedagogy perspectives. Translates & facilitates between authors, product teams, and vendors to ensure that content is effectively authored to meet product specs and objectives. \+ Conducts preliminary assessment of cost and technology feasibility & business opportunity for implementing new product features and content. Informs business cases for product feature & content requirements to evaluate against defined product models & business priorities. \+ Manages vendor & technology partner relationships to ensure requirements, capabilities & standards, planned development, and timelines meet product goals and market expectations. \+ Provides ready input, support, and guidance to sales, marketing, implementation, and support teams for current and forthcoming digital products and learning tools for both Pearson Higher Ed and likely competitors. \+ Supports continuous content improvement capability based on customer feedback, usage patterns and other data to improve learner experience. Qualifications BA or BS required. Relevant graduate-level work is a plus.1 yr of customer- facing or sales experience, especially presenting/facilitating complex ideas or new technology. Experience in education or corporate learning industries a plus.1 yrs of product management or new product development experience.Must be willing to work with remote teams and travel at least once a quarter.Strong interpersonal skills with a focus on teamwork and the ability to foster/maintain relationships internally and externally.Great written and oral communication skills, as well as presentation skills.Excellent project management skills, including ability to effectively manage a high volume of simultaneous projects. Proven track record in developing project plans for complex digital projects and delivering the required technology/software/digital content on schedule. Exceptional attention to detail and ability to balance short-term and long-term deadlines.Solid grounding in web and mobile software technologies with proven ability to work closely with vendors and development teams.Familiarity with and understanding of the most current digital and mobile technologies.The ideal candidate will have a passion for innovative technology and improving education. Research Staff Member, Distributed Deep Learning Platform: Job Description IBM Research is the innovation engine of IBM. Nearly every game-changing breakthrough in the information technology industry has its roots in an IBM Research lab. It has been a home for creative scientific minds since 1945, when Thomas J. Watson Sr. established the first corporate pure science research lab in the U.S. We are primed to define the future of technology for many years to come specifically around the world of Artificial Intelligence. We believe AI will transform the world in dramatic ways in the coming years – and our Research AI group is advancing the field through our portfolio of research and through collaboration with like-minded institutions including MIT (MIT-IBM Watson Lab - http://mitibmwatsonailab.mit.edu) and individuals to push the boundaries of AI faster – for the benefit of industry and society. Job Description We’re looking for Researchers with expertise in Distributed Systems as well as Machine Learning and Deep Learning to conduct foundational research. As a Research Staff Member working on our AI platform projects, you will work on ground-breaking and exciting projects. You will help design and implement state of the art AI systems that will have an impact on real world initiatives. You will collaborate with some of the brightest minds to take AI research ideas and turn them into scalable and robust systems. We want to bring out the best in you and expect you to do the same to us. Your dedicated approach to creative problem solving will be essential to the success of our team and the company. Responsibilities You will develop algorithms, protocols, and distributed system architectures for a new generation AI platform Work to continuously improve the AI platform’s infrastructure, capabilities and reach Provide improvements and advancements to the platform’s deep learning component to lower the barrier of entry for AI model creation and management Collaborate with other researchers, engineers and team members on theoretical and practical projects You will conduct world-class research in AI, publish in top-tier conferences and journals and file patent disclosures when appropriate You will assist in the development and commercialization of the meaningful assets 081583 Required Technical and Professional Expertise PhD in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or related technical fields Expertise with large-scale system engineering and distributed systems Experience with deep learning frameworks with the ability to work independently with the latest AI tools and frameworks Expertise with any of the following languages: Python, Java, C, C++, Go, Julia Validated background, publication record and experience in communicating your research in technical communities Proven social skills and ability to work in a team are meaningful Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Advanced skill level with standard machine learning techniques and frameworks including but not limited to TensorFlow, PyTorch Experience with automated distributed deployment and scaling technologies such as Kubernetes and Docker Experience with one or more of the following areas: hyper-parameter tuning, reinforcement learning, knowledge engineering, reasoning, planning, decision-making EO Statement IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. CCEP certification is a plus Self-driven and ability to lead Here is a little about us: With more than 25 years’ experience, SAI Global is a privately held company with operations throughout the world, including North America, Asia-Pacific, and EMEA. In 2016 SAI Global leadership unanimously supported a $1 billion takeover bid from private equity firm Baring Private Equity Asia. Today, SAI Global and Baring Private Equity remain committed to extending their global reach and developing their position as a market leader in the development and delivery of B2B governance, compliance and risk management solutions. SAI Global Compliance provides a full range of governance, risk and compliance (GRC) software applications, learning and awareness solutions and advisory consulting services. With over 28 offices worldwide, the Company combines deep expertise with practical technology solutions to help thousands of organizations reduce risk, enhance compliance, streamline governance and make better decisions. At SAI Global, we help organizations proactively manage risk to achieve business excellence, growth, sustainability and ultimately, create trust. Our integrated risk management solutions are a combination of world-class tech platforms, learning tools, and advisory services that operate across the entire lifecycle allowing businesses to focus on opportunities presented by uncertainty. Together, these tools and content services enable customers to develop a holistic, integrated view of risk. SAI Global head office is located in Chicago. We employ more than 2,000 people across 29 countries and 51 locations across Europe, the Middle East, Africa, the Americas, Asia and the Pacific.

 Inventory Specialist: What does a Best Buy Inventory Specialist do? At Best Buy our mission is to leverage the unique talents and passions of our employees to inspire, delight, and enrich the lives of our customers through technology and all its possibilities. If you have a passion and curiosity for what is possible and enjoy people, we invite you to join us on this mission. This position is responsible to receive and ship merchandise to/from store and to stock merchandise in the warehouse or on the sales floor. 80% of your time you will: Receive and ship store merchandise: Removes merchandise from truck and compare against packing list. Applies security tag to product and moves it to sales floor or warehouse storage. Packages merchandise for shipment and completes bill of lading for transfers Packages merchandise for shipment to return to Distribution Centers. Operates equipment according to company safety standards to assist in moving merchandise. Stocks merchandise on the sales floor. Assists in the receiving of drop shipments Prepares merchandise for home delivery. Accurately documents movement of merchandise. Completes paperwork for store receiving, transfers, home delivery, DEVO, Junk Out. 10% of your time you will: Provide and maintain store appearance: Ensures clean parking lot, sidewalks, store entry, aisles, restrooms, warehouse area. Properly disposes of debris, boxes. 10% of your time you will: Provides carryout service for customers: Safely loads merchandise in customer’s vehicle. Verifies receipt against merchandise. What are the professional requirements of an Inventory Specialist? Basic Qualifications Ability to work successfully as part of a team Ability to work a flexible schedule inclusive of holidays, nights and weekends Ability to lift or maneuver 50-100 pounds, with or without accommodations Preferred Qualifications 3 months experience in retail, customer service or related fields What are my rewards and benefits? Surrounded by the latest and greatest technology, a team of amazing coworkers and a work environment where anything is possible, you’ll find it easy to be your best when you work at Best Buy. While you’re making technology work for our customers, we’re making sure Best Buy works for you with our pay for performance philosophy. At Best Buy we offer top salaries for management, including both short and long term incentive plans based upon business results, as well as endless opportunities to grow in a dynamic work environment that’s part of an industry that never sleeps. From tuition reimbursement to deep employee discounts, to health, wealth and wellness benefits, we believe the success of our company depends on the passion of employees for learning, technology and people.

In doing so, she/he will help to create an organization that leads in celebrating art and artists, recognition by our community and visitors of the necessity of art and our museum in their lives, and positive change in how we learn from each other. A big thinker, this leader will also be someone who thrives on getting structures right, and knowing how to put a team together. That team will be dynamic and forward looking, leading change within the Museum and advocating for opportunities to integrate the diverse voices of our communities that we may better understand the issues of our times always through the lens of art. A commitment to making excellent and timely decisions, clearly as one who thrives on moving plans and objectives forward. Ability to manage, mentor and retain talent through commitment to training and professional development of staff. A commitment to supporting and contributing to the success of an institution’s business and financial imperatives. Our mission is to push the envelope in Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR), Natural Language Understanding (NLU), and Audio Signal Processing, in order to provide the best-possible experience for our customers. As a Scientist, you will work with talented peers to develop novel algorithms and modeling techniques to advance the state of the art in spoken language understanding. Your work will directly impact our customers in the form of products and services that make use of speech and language technology. You will leverage Amazon’s heterogeneous data sources and large-scale computing resources to accelerate advances in spoken language understanding. We are hiring in all areas of spoken language understanding: ASR, NLU, text- to-speech (TTS), and Dialog Management. Position Responsibilities: Participate in the design, development, evaluation, deployment and updating of data-driven models and analytical solutions for machine learning (ML) and/or natural language (NL) applications. Develop and/or apply statistical modeling techniques (e.g. Bayesian models and deep neural networks), optimization methods, and other ML techniques to different applications in business and engineering. Routinely build and deploy ML models on available data. Research and implement novel ML and statistical approaches to add value to the business. Mentor junior engineers and scientists. Basic Qualifications Graduate degree (MS or PhD) in Electrical Engineering, Computer Sciences, or Mathematics with specialization in speech recognition, natural language processing, or machine learning. Familiar with programming languages such as C/C++, Java, Perl or Python. Preferred Qualifications Experience in building speech recognition and natural language processing systems (e.g. commercial speech products or government speech projects) Solid Machine Learning background and familiar with standard speech and machine learning techniques. Scientific thinking and the ability to invent, a track record of thought leadership and contributions that have advanced the field Solid software development experience Good written and spoken communication skills. We can do this because we are independent and 100% employee-owned. As we enter the next phase of growth, our challenge is not to lose any of our character and values. Additional Information The Division of Continuing Education (DCE) comprises several entities including the Harvard Extension School, the Harvard Summer School, the Harvard Professional Development Programs and the Harvard Institute for Learning in Retirement. For more than a century, Harvard Extension School has made Harvard faculty and teaching accessible to a diverse community of local, national, and international students. Harvard Extension School enrolls approximately 13,000 students per year in approximately 65 liberal arts and professional fields. More than 650 open enrollment online and classroom courses are offered at affordable prices to our communities across the world. Harvard Summer School offers approximately 300 courses on the Harvard Campus to 6,000 secondary school, college and adult learners and more than 30 international study abroad programs for up to 600 students each summer. The Division also includes the Harvard Institute for Learning in Retirement with approximately 550 active members and Harvard Professional Development Programs offering about 60 two- day, noncredit courses annually. All formal written offers will be made by FAS Human Resources. Senior Learning Designer: Description At Pearson, we’re committed to a world that’s always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. From bringing lectures vividly to life to turning textbooks into laptop lessons, we are always re-examining the way people learn best, whether it’s one child in our own backyard or an education community across the globe. We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explore new frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires us to always be better. By pushing the boundaries of technology — and each other to surpass these boundaries — we create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for the world’s innovations, personal and global, large and small. The Senior Learning Designer will be part of an elite team dedicated to innovating on research-based approaches to content design in order to optimize learning within Pearson’s next generation of evidence-based, global technology products. The Senior Learning Designer will collaborate with product managers, portfolio managers, product model managers, user-experience designers, and researchers on a portfolio of technology products that includes platforms, underlying systems, learning applications, courseware, content collections, mobile solutions, and adaptive learning environments. Learning Design Core Values: We use evidence to drive designs that make more impactful and enjoyable learning experiences. \+ We are fiercely learner-centric. \+ We insist on evidence. \+ We build using Learning Design Principles, not fads. \+ We change how people learn. The Senior Learning Designer will be responsible for six key functions: \+ Create evidence-based design recommendations for the design of content within digital next gen learning experiences, incorporating education research, teaching and learning models, and discipline context in collaboration with others in a range of job functions such as education design researchers, learning scientists, UX designers, editorial managers, product managers, and content developers (45%) \+ Participate in product ideation, innovation, and iteration (20%) \+ Build learning design capacity within the organization through training and initiatives involving educative design. (15%) \+ Participate in the learner validation, and subsequent iteration, of concepts to support the optimization of product components and learning capabilities through content design within titles (10%) \+ Contribute to other design, development, research, and evaluation tasks, as needed (10%) The Senior Learning Designer must be an independent and technically-adept problem-solver, who can juggle multiple high-volume responsibilities with great autonomy and initiative in a remote environment, while always demonstrating exceptional communication skills and a solution-oriented attitude amidst a dynamic climate of rapid change. This position requires strong project management expertise, exceptional virtual office skills, and outstanding interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills. Pearson Learning & Experience Design utilizes a dynamic model of flexible capacity in which this position may be requested to lead or contribute to other development efforts depending upon product release schedules. Thus, preference will be given to candidates with complementary skills in diversified areas related to online learning, innovation, and assessment. Qualifications \+ Master’s degree or higher in Learning Science, Cognitive Psychology, Educational Technology, Educational Psychology, Human Factors, Instructional Design, Assessment, Learning Design, Curriculum Design, or related field required \+ Minimum of three years participating in the design of learning technology, software, or learning environments. \+ Significant experience gathering and applying peer-reviewed scholarly research and user research \+ Previous instructional design and user-centered design testing experience preferred \+ Previous online and/or classroom teaching experience preferred but not sufficient \+ Skills/knowledge/abilities: \+ Deep and demonstrated knowledge of learning design principles from cognitive psychology and allied fields \+ Demonstrated experience synthesizing and applying research from the learning sciences to product design in clear, tangible, documented ways \+ Demonstrated understanding of evidence-based, learner-centered design processes, techniques, and tools \+ Demonstrated experience participating in the design of learner interfaces and learner experiences \+ Demonstrated experience designing assessment within digital learning experiences \+ Demonstrated experience creating design concepts and lightweight prototypes \+ Demonstrated experience collaborating effectively in highly matrixed, dispersed, cross-functional teams \+ Demonstrated experience contributing to complex technology systems with numerous stakeholders and requirements \+ Demonstrated experience applying design thinking to learning experience designs. Merchandising Specialist: What does a Best Buy Merchandising Specialist do? At Best Buy our mission is to leverage the unique talents and passions of our employees to inspire, delight, and enrich the lives of our customers through technology and all its possibilities. If you have a passion and curiosity for what is possible and enjoy people, we invite you to join us on this mission. This position is responsible to implement assigned responsibilities from Merchandising Senior in merchandising designated areas, upstocks merchandise to ensure department is continually stocked and replenished, and confirms the accuracy and timeliness of implementing special program guidelines. You will also assist customers in locating product. 45% of your time you will: Following weekly merchandising packet instructions, merchandises designated areas: Checks in drop shipments, truck shipments, and GEO shuttles. Confirms products are put on sales floor properly and in a timely manner. Arranges product according to planogram specifications. Performs ad set, price change, clean & bright, functionality and farming duties. Insure check-out lanes are set with proper product in each line. 25% of your time you will: Monitors floor merchandise: Upstocks overstock product when necessary. Downstocks product when necessary. Moves all product off of the sales floor prior to opening. 20% of your time you will: Ensures program guidelines are followed: Confirms Raincheck Follow up is completed. Confirms functionality checks are complete and problems reported to the manager. Brings "lock-up" product to front checkout lanes for customer purchases. Confirms closeout and open item program guidelines are followed. 10% of your time you will: Greets customer and assists with locating product What are the professional requirements of an Merchandising Specialist? Basic Qualifications Ability to work successfully as part of a team Ability to work a flexible schedule inclusive of holidays, nights and weekends Ability to lift or maneuver 50-100 pounds, with or without accommodations Preferred Qualifications 3 months experience in retail, customer service or related fields What are my rewards and benefits?  General Warehouse Worker: What does a Best Buy General Warehouse Worker do? As a General Warehouse Worker, you will facilitate moving product throughout the distribution center through use of equipment in areas such as Receiving, Stocking, Shipping, Non-Con, Order Processing and Replenishment. Your responsibilities will include operating equipment in a safe manner, while making sure that you are maintaining a safe and clean working area and ensuring that our product is in perfect condition to sell to our customers. The responsibilities listed below are encompassing of a General Warehouse Worker but may vary by departmental assignment Essential Functions Unload and process receipt of merchandise from inbound trucks Stocks merchandise that has been received into specific designated locations Process all orders by locating specified product and moving product to the loading dock Packs smaller products into larger containers for shipment to stores Loads merchandise onto trucks for shipment to company locations Maintains a clean work area by removing empty pallets, sweeping and cleaning up boxes and other debris. Must be able to pass all applicable certification and driving requirements to become licensed for operating equipment in the RDC Non-essential Functions Perform other duties as apparent or assigned What are the professional requirements of a General Warehouse Worker? Basic Qualifications: Able to individually lift and maneuver 40 lbs frequently and repetitively (up to a maximum of 75 lbs; with or without reasonable accommodation) Preferred Qualifications High School Diploma or Equivalent What are my rewards and benefits?  Learning & Development Specialist II: Purpose and Passion • Comprehensive Benefits • Life-Work Integration • Community • Career Growth At Boston Scientific, you will find a collaborative culture driven by a passion for innovation that keeps us connected on the most essential level. With determination, imagination and a deep caring for human life, we’re solving some of the most important healthcare industry challenges. Together, we’re one global team committed to making a difference in people’s lives around the world. This is a place where you can find a career with meaningful purpose—improving lives through your life’s work. About the role: Talent Management exists to improve organizational and leadership effectiveness, and to build workforce capabilities to substantially improve business performance and the quality of patient care. This is accomplished by effectively developing relevant and timely leadership and organizational interventions, and by leading and managing the end-to-end life cycle of a learning process to deliver the right training, to the right people, at the right time, in the right way, personalized and seamlessly. Your responsibilities include: Consulting with business and functional leadership to understand business problems and identify opportunities to enhance performance through training or other solutions. Anticipating future development needs based on business requirements and changes and forecast delivery needs. Working with HR Business Partners and clients on change management activities in a rapid paced environment with expansive growth. Helping train new managers on diversity and inclusion, employee relations, and performance management. Completing Team Launch curriculum with new and re-forming teams. Working with HRBPs to complete team interventions and increase team performance. Coaching and providing feedback on 360 instruments, Insights and other assessments as defined. Leading, managing and facilitating Talent Management courses and programs and learning solutions. Identifying and qualifying instructors, both internal and external. Continually evaluating instructor effectiveness. Leading, managing and/or supporting new programs in the Central Region. Designing and developing learning solutions. Collaborating with internal subject matter experts and/or cross-functional teams for content development. May also work to identify external programs, resources and vendors that specifically meet learning & development needs. Working with vendors to provide quality cost effective solutions. May lead and/or support negotiations of resources, schedules, contracts and fees for both internal and externally developed programs. Measuring learning program effectiveness; may design, implement, or support the development and use learning assessment methodologies and tools. Providing feedback into the Talent Management life cycle management processes. May lead, manage or participate on cross-functional or global Talent Management teams to continuously improve Talent Management processes. May be responsible for the end-to-end lifecycle management of a learning solution, project, program or set of programs. What we're looking for: Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree, (Masters preferred) Minimum of 5-7 years of learning & development experience Performance consulting experience Experience with class and team facilitation and interventions Understanding of diversity and inclusiveness in the workplace and learning styles Enthusiastic learner Designs innovative and creative content and delivery methods Passion for facilitating change in individuals, teams and organizations Demonstrates caring and respect in interactions Very strong organizational skills; able to prioritize multiple matters calmly and effectively Ability to work independently and take initiative where appropriate Strong collaboration skills to work team members, internal clients, stakeholders and management Ability to maintain confidentiality Desire to drive results and outcomes and is accountable About us As a global medical technology leader for more than 35 years, our mission at Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) is to transform lives through innovative medical solutions that improve the health of patients. If you’re looking to truly make a difference to people both around the world and around the corner, there’s no better place to make it happen. Chief Equity & Inclusion Officer: The Chief Equity and Inclusion Officer (CEIO) is responsible for developing, implementing and advocating for a comprehensive health equity, inclusion and diversity strategy for Children's Minnesota. This role is in direct service of Children's vision to be every family's essential partner in raising healthier children. The CEIO will align critical elements of a clinical equity strategy and oversee execution of prioritized, sequenced projects/initiatives in collaboration with other senior and executive leaders across the organization. These critical elements include: addressing organizational/structural inequities, clinical/quality interventions, developing recruitment and retention strategies, as it relates to diversity and inclusion, that help create an open and inclusive workforce environment, fostering community engagement and building organizational awareness. This leader will provide direction and create accountability to the equity plan with executive leadership and organizational leaders. S/he will provide strategic and operational level guidance and consultation to relevant teams and leaders, including the medical leadership teams. In partnership with/reporting to the Chief Legal Officer and Chief Medical Officer, the CEIO will advise Children's executive team and Board of Directors on appropriate approaches and commensurate resources to advance equity and inclusion. Qualifications : Education: Bachelor's degree required. Experience: 10+ years of experience in relevant areas,including but not limited to organizational health equity, clinical practice serving diverse populations, racial and social justice, and/or advocacy on behalf of marginalized populations Progressive organizational leadership and influential experience with demonstrated ability to drive strategic change and outcomes in equity, diversity, inclusion and related areas Demonstrated ability to create and implement organizational strategies and budgets Demonstrated ability to build effective relationships and influence at all staff and leadership levels, both internally and externally, with sustained and accountable relationships Strong written and verbal communication skills, with prior experience in translating difficult concepts to various audiences, identify personal motivations for engagement and to help audiences advance their understanding of equity along a developmental trajectory Strong management skills, with particular attention to managing diverse teams with varying cultural norms and experiences Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: A fundamental understanding of the dynamic and complex healthcare environment, and the multiple stakeholders involved in advancing health equity within a large health care system A deep personal commitment to equity, racial justice and diversity and inclusion; demonstrated proficiency with justice concepts Ability to provide high level synthesis of data to guide relevant clinical interventions; ability to lead other analysts and team members in the accurate generation and interpretation of data elements Ability to foster ongoing learning and development for self and team Ability to work at a fast pace while managing multiple tasks Ability to initiate projects and see them through to completion Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information appropriately Ability to influence and impact an organization by being both catalyst and strategist Proven ability to problem solve, assessing organizational and individual readiness for solutions and modification of pacing to best shape outcomesAchieves Outcomes Makes sound decisions Draws accurate conclusions from financial and quantitative information Ensures that patient/family/employee/customer issues are resolved Prepares realistic estimates of resource requirements needed to accomplish goals Holds people accountable for achieving goals Creates/Inspires Shared Vision Promotes ideas and actions that align with Children's vision and mission with confidence and enthusiasm Fosters, in self and in staff, energy, ownership, meaning and personal commitment to the work Meets organizational and clinical teams at a place of mutual engagement, ability to inspire hesitant audiences to approach change Communicates clearly Communicates clearly and influences others Uses, and communicates, information and rationale for decisions which align employees with organization's strategic priorities Proactively shares timely updates and information with staff Appropriately involves others in decisions and plans that affect themDevelops Individuals/Teams Provides honest, helpful feedback to others on their performance Sets high standards of performance for self and others Celebrates, recognizes and rewards significant achievements of others
Executive Assistant: Overview Bain & Company Bain & Company is the management consulting firm that the world’s business leaders come to when they want results. Bain advises clients on strategy, operations, information technology, organization, private equity, digital transformation and strategy, and mergers and acquisition, developing practical insights that clients act on and transferring skills that make change stick. The firm aligns its incentives with clients by linking its fees to their results. Bain clients have outperformed the stock market 4 to 1. Founded in 1973, Bain has 55 offices in 36 countries, and its deep expertise and client roster cross every industry and economic sector. FRWD FRWD is a unique digital marketing agency designed to build client capability through a comprehensive approach to helping companies make the best digital marketing investments. To do so, FRWD extends client teams through co-location of top creative, media optimization, data science, and advertising technology teams to shorten test cycle time and leverage learnings to move forward. The agency also acquires and trains talent for clients to create sustainable campaigns and drive continual improvement without further FRWD presence. FRWD works with some of the world’s most recognized consumer brands, leading healthcare providers, entertainment companies and more. FRWD is based in Minneapolis. Job Description Based in Minneapolis, the Executive Assistant (EA) will provide comprehensive administrative and organizational support to the FRWD leadership team that includes but is not limited to calendar management, arranging travel schedules, and weekly time and expense reporting. The EA will also provide office support (e.g., planning events (onsite and offsite), scheduling leadership team meetings, scheduling trainings, and providing backup reception coverage). You will join a team that is supportive, accessible, and rich with training opportunities. external meetings, for the EVP and Senior Experts Organize internal meetings to include conference room scheduling and ordering/setting up meals Organize external meetings to include working with other offices or offsite locations to arrange meeting space, supplies, accommodations, meals and offsite events Receive, screen and/or route all incoming telephone calls, mail, publications and correspondence Track and process expenses for submission to Finance Senior Expert support (35%) Coordinate detailed travel arrangements with Bain Travel and outside agencies, including air, hotel, car, and other reservations as required Track and process expenses for submission to Finance _Office Services (25%)_ Partner with FRWD’s Coordinator, Office Services to plan and execute office events, hoping to drive employee engagement through participation Schedule office-wide meetings (e.g., Town Halls, trainings, etc.), including conference room scheduling and ordering/setting up meals Provide backup coverage for reception area Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or at least six years of relevant experience required A minimum of 1-2 years of administrative assistant experience, prior executive  Asset Protection Associate: What does a Best Buy Asset Protection Associate do? At Best Buy our mission is to leverage the unique talents and passions of our employees to inspire, delight, and enrich the lives our customers through technology and all its possibilities. If you have a passion and curiosity for what is possible and enjoy people, we invite you to join us on this mission. A Best Buy Asset Protection Associate coaches and leads employees in asset protection best practices to ensure a safe, secure and profitable environment throughout the store. They work with the Asset Protection Lead to resolve any hazards or compliance issues and investigate any accidents. They also demonstrate preparedness and exhibit behaviors for proper emergency response procedures. At Best Buy we give you plenty of ways to challenge yourself. You’ll find working in a high-paced retail environment increases your ability to solve problems, multitask and work in a team environment. Further, our leadership is committed to helping you succeed in your current role and prepare you for the next through coaching and performance appraisals. 40% of your time you will: Monitor the store for potential security risks and alarm function. Protect against fraudulent activity by creating AP Alerts and reporting and documenting incidents properly when necessary. 30% of your time you will: Teach and coach store employees about the principles, standards and policies related to safety and crisis events and monitor their fulfillment. Work with the Asset Protection Lead and others to resolve any hazards or compliance issues and investigate any employee or customer accidents. 30% of your time you will: Interact with customers and store employees to maintain a safe and profitable environment. What are the Professional Requirements of a Best Buy Asset Protection Associate? Basic Qualifications Ability to work successfully as part of a team Ability to work a flexible schedule inclusive of holidays, nights and weekends Ability to lift or maneuver 50-100 pounds, with or without accommodations Preferred Qualifications 3 months experience in retail, customer service or related fields What are my rewards and benefits?
