 Inventory Specialist: What does a Best Buy Inventory Specialist do? At Best Buy our mission is to leverage the unique talents and passions of our employees to inspire, delight, and enrich the lives of our customers through technology and all its possibilities. If you have a passion and curiosity for what is possible and enjoy people, we invite you to join us on this mission. This position is responsible to receive and ship merchandise to/from store and to stock merchandise in the warehouse or on the sales floor. 80% of your time you will: Receive and ship store merchandise: Removes merchandise from truck and compare against packing list. Applies security tag to product and moves it to sales floor or warehouse storage. Packages merchandise for shipment and completes bill of lading for transfers Packages merchandise for shipment to return to Distribution Centers. Operates equipment according to company safety standards to assist in moving merchandise. Stocks merchandise on the sales floor. Assists in the receiving of drop shipments Prepares merchandise for home delivery. Accurately documents movement of merchandise. Completes paperwork for store receiving, transfers, home delivery, DEVO, Junk Out. 10% of your time you will: Provide and maintain store appearance: Ensures clean parking lot, sidewalks, store entry, aisles, restrooms, warehouse area. Properly disposes of debris, boxes. 10% of your time you will: Provides carryout service for customers: Safely loads merchandise in customer’s vehicle. Verifies receipt against merchandise. What are the professional requirements of an Inventory Specialist? Basic Qualifications Ability to work successfully as part of a team Ability to work a flexible schedule inclusive of holidays, nights and weekends Ability to lift or maneuver 50-100 pounds, with or without accommodations Preferred Qualifications 3 months experience in retail, customer service or related fields What are my rewards and benefits?  Sales Representative-Minneapolis MN Neuroscience Primary Care: As a Neurosciences Primary Care Sales Representative you are responsible for effectively handling a defined territory with a customer focused approach on the health care providers in that territory. Territory Management: Develop and implement territory business plans to deliver strong sales results and achieve sales targets Represent Lilly as a leader in the Neurosciences community and marketplace Operate with high integrity and follow all Lilly policies and procedures Customer Focus: Promote product portfolio to HCPs through value-based conversations and communicate safety, efficacy, and treatment expectations Partner with customers to understand practice workflow and patient needs within the practice Provide resources that enhance or exceed customer needs for disease-state information and product-specific support Assist and coordinate critical activities with physicians and office staff through the drug initiation process, device training, patient support programs, and follow-up where applicable Collaborate and partner with peers in the Neurosciences sales organization, brand team, and other support partners to deliver an extraordinary customer experience Connect with access specialists, and other commercial partners to ensure a positive patient experience with treatment Disease State and Neuroscience Market Knowledge: Develop deep disease-state, product, and competitor knowledge, as well as understanding local and regional market trends Share key findings with teammates to serve as a learning resource within the Geo-managed team Earn reputation as a subject-matter authority and a valued resource Company Overview Are you seeking a career that makes a difference in the world? Would you like a career where you can use your sales experience and skills? At Lilly, we serve an extraordinary purpose. We make a difference for people around the globe by discovering, developing and delivering medicines that help them live longer, healthier, more active lives. Not only do we deliver breakthrough medications, but you also can count on us to develop creative solutions to support communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. For over 25 years, Lilly has been committed to helping people suffering from migraine, investigating more than a dozen different compounds for the treatment of migraine and disabling headache disorders. These research programs have accelerated understanding of this disease and advanced the development of Lilly's comprehensive late-stage development programs studying the launch of a Migraine portfolio for prevention of migraine and cluster headache, and for the acute treatment of migraine. Our goal is to make life better for people with migraine by offering comprehensive solutions to prevent or stop this disabling disease. The combined clinical, academic and professional experience of our experts helps us to build our research portfolio, identify challenges for healthcare providers and pinpoint the needs of people living with migraine and cluster headache. Sound interesting to you? Read on to find out more about how you can join our sales team, where you will enjoy meaningful work, build a successful career and make important contributions to our patients’ lives.  DDC Warehouse Clerical Aide: What does a Best Buy DDC Warehouse Clerical Aide do? To process records, enter data and prepare reports for the receiving, order processing, shipping and inventory control areas of the Delivery Distribution Center. The Warehouse Clerical Support role is typically assigned to specific areas within the Delivery Distribution Center, i.e. Receiving, Home Delivery and Installation Support, and Shipping. Therefore, the job may entail one or more of the following duties and responsibilities. The time spent on the duties varies based on the area in which the duties are performed. Essential Functions Enters, corrects and verifies data on the computer. Uses spreadsheet and WMS computer programs to enter bills of lading, transfer, manifest, receiving and inventory information. Verifies and corrects data as appropriate. Completes Delivery Distribution Center reports (i.e. control logs, shipping logs, quality audits, cube reports, seal logs, daily receiving data log, etc.) Receives information from warehouse workers, truck drivers and computer generated reports. Categorizes data and summarizes onto departmental forms. Distributes reports to appropriate personnel. Processes Delivery Distribution Center paperwork. Receives copies of freight claims from warehouse workers, verifies information against shipping documents, files copies and routes to relevant departments. Completes expediter assistance requests by researching problems with purchase orders, determining and indicating source of problem and routing completed request to warehouse workers. Processes orders by getting labels, recording information on batch control log and summarizing data. Verifies and processes stock transfers. Creates daily check-in receiving documents for receiving dock workers. Non-Essential Functions Establishes and maintains filing systems. Files bill of ladings, manifests, transfers and receiving data according to date and store location. Performs other duties as apparent or assigned. What are the professional qualifications of a Best Buy DDC Warehouse Clerical Aide? Basic Qualification: 6 months of clerk, administrative and/or receptionist experience Preferred Qualification: High School Diploma/GED Microsoft Office suite experience (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.) What are my rewards and benefits? Discover your career here! At Geek Squad and Best Buy we offer much more than a paycheck. Your responsibilities will include making sure our assets are in perfect condition to sell to our customers while contributing to a safe and clean work environment. The responsibilities listed below are encompassing of a Merchandise Processor but may vary by departmental assignment Essential Functions Pick merchandise from designated areas to fulfill customer and store orders Use of an RF Scanner to read barcodes and process merchandise by moving it to proper areas E-Commerce – fulfillment of customer orders by packing and shipping product to customers Bundles – create product bundles by picking and packing individual products into larger packages Maintain a clean work area by removing empty pallets, sweeping and cleaning up boxes and other debris. Non-essential Functions Perform other duties as apparent or assigned. What are the professional qualifications of a Best Buy DC Merchandise Processor eCommerce? DC Loss Prevention Officer: What does a Best Buy DC Loss Prevention Officer do? The Distribution Center (DC) Asset Protection Officer ensures the safety of DC employees as well as the integrity of inventory by monitoring activities through personal observation and closed circuit television system. The Loss Prevention Officer may be exposed to inclement weather while operating handheld metal detectors, hand held radios, and must be willing to work at both the front desk and guard house. Excellent interpersonal and observational skills are critical to success. Key Responsibilities Include: Monitors employees entering and exiting the warehouse area Enforces facility visitor procedures Ensures C-TPAT procedures are followed Complete Regular loss prevention reports Answering incoming telephone calls, both at the front desk and the guard house What are the professional qualifications of a Best Buy DC Loss Prevention Officer? Teacher Innovation Lead - East: Do you want to help to shape the future of education? Do you want to be part of the team that’s building the applications and services that will revolutionize the learning experience? If yes, then we have just the right opportunity for you! We have a series of new initiatives under our Education team which is chartered with creating unique sets of experiences for students, teachers, administrators and parents. Our goal is to empower every student and teacher in the world to achieve more and help students share their voice. In Education, institutions around the world are defining 1:1 learning initiatives to increase student and educator access to technology and truly enhance the learning opportunities in and outside the classroom. Transforming an education agenda for the 21st Century is about much more than providing a child with a low-cost computing device. Central to the success of these projects is an end to end and holistic approach that combines not just devices, but also systems architecture, applications, content, professional development and training, services and clear definition of outcomes that can be measured and supported by all the stakeholders. Microsoft’s mission is to help students and educators throughout the world realize their full potential by providing real impact for better learning outcomes through Microsoft technology, programs and thought leadership. Responsibilities In what is one of the most exciting areas for both our customers and Microsoft as a company, Microsoft Product Team is looking for experienced, talented leader in the role of Teacher Innovation Lead, responsible for the Educator audience, reporting to the head of User Engagement for Flipgrid. The Teacher Innovation Lead will be responsible for actively engaging the educator community via social media, emails, the Student Voice Ambassador Community, Flipgrid Educators Facebook community, and in-person. The role will need to proactively communicate with the engagement team for Flipgrid/Microsoft Education Product Team and listen to, ideate on, and improve upon current initiatives. Some of these initiatives include: event engagement (attending and hosting), professional development events, blog posts, customer visits, amplifying community educators, and conducting webinars. Qualifications Qualifications are: Bachelor’s Degree in Education or related discipline required. 3+ years of in-classroom education experience 3+ years of engagement experience with an emphasis on teacher and student classroom communication A strong working knowledge of different social media outlets 1+ year of experience working on educational programs involving technology in the classroom, with measurable success metrics and broad communication requirements Bonus Credit for: Deep understanding of core educational issues and trends, both in the United States and internationally Ability to think strategically to bring about successful bold bets for the Educator audience and remain competitive in market Ability to build strong partnerships across organizational lines Understanding of the Education industry and drivers of educator audience within this community Strong presentation, written, and verbal communication skills and working across various geographical and cultural environments as they would serve as spokespeople Demonstrated strategic time management and multi-tasking skills Is a resourceful problem-solver, leveraging internal and partner resources where and when needed to do what’s right for the customer and for the organization Working effectively within a virtual team, taking strategic direction and considering inputs from team members Passion for education, the customer and driving disruptive change Flipgrid Ambassador, Google Certified Educator, or Microsoft Innovative Educator Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  Merchandising Specialist: What does a Best Buy Merchandising Specialist do? At Best Buy our mission is to leverage the unique talents and passions of our employees to inspire, delight, and enrich the lives of our customers through technology and all its possibilities. If you have a passion and curiosity for what is possible and enjoy people, we invite you to join us on this mission. This position is responsible to implement assigned responsibilities from Merchandising Senior in merchandising designated areas, upstocks merchandise to ensure department is continually stocked and replenished, and confirms the accuracy and timeliness of implementing special program guidelines. You will also assist customers in locating product. 45% of your time you will: Following weekly merchandising packet instructions, merchandises designated areas: Checks in drop shipments, truck shipments, and GEO shuttles. Confirms products are put on sales floor properly and in a timely manner. Arranges product according to planogram specifications. Performs ad set, price change, clean & bright, functionality and farming duties. Insure check-out lanes are set with proper product in each line. 25% of your time you will: Monitors floor merchandise: Upstocks overstock product when necessary. Downstocks product when necessary. Moves all product off of the sales floor prior to opening. 20% of your time you will: Ensures program guidelines are followed: Confirms Raincheck Follow up is completed. Confirms functionality checks are complete and problems reported to the manager. Brings "lock-up" product to front checkout lanes for customer purchases. Confirms closeout and open item program guidelines are followed. 10% of your time you will: Greets customer and assists with locating product What are the professional requirements of an Merchandising Specialist? They are essential to the cration of curriculum and delivery methods which are relevant and aligned to support diverse learning styles. This includes but is not limited to providing input to management to aid in the assessment of training needs and curriculum development. They partner and engage closely with the regional Training Manager, Sr. Director NORAM Operations and client specific program management to outline and execute a training strategy and roadmap for the region. 1) Responsible for new-hire and ongoing training and certification of front- line employees and supervisors in conjunction with scheduling allowances; supports consistency in all front-line employees' performance through uniform training delivery. 2) Participates in required train-the-trainer classes as necessary 3) Provides feedback to curriculum developers through participation in pilot and beta testing; gathers input from employees and customer feedback systems to make recommendations for curriculum revisions and creation. 4) Identifies training needs and makes recommendations to the Training Manager and client specific program management teams. 5) Continually monitors training consumption against competency requirements of individuals. 6) Assists with the creation and updates of all manner of curriculum related to client or project specifics including web-based learning materials. 7) Performs all duties and responsibilities in a timely and effective manner in accordance with established company policies to achieve the overall objectives of this position. 8) Maintains a favorable working relationship with all other company employees to foster and promote a cooperative and harmonious working climate, which will be conducive to maximum employee morale, productivity, and efficiency/effectiveness. 9) Projects a favorable image of the company to promote its aims and objectives and foster and enhance public recognition and acceptance of all of its areas of endeavor. 10) Keeps immediate superior promptly and fully informed of all problems or unusual matters of significance and takes prompt corrective action where necessary or suggests alternative courses of action which may be taken. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent meetings & events/group transport training experience. Minimum 3-5 years of training experience. Experience in Meetings & Events industry highly preferred. Associate professional in talent development (APTD) or Certified Professional in Learning and Performance (CPLP) preferred. Strong computer knowledge, specifically in Microsoft Office Suite, Visio, Webex, and other curriculum development, learning management, and training delivery platforms. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills both internally and client facing. Deep knowledge of the meetings and events and group transport business. Ability to present processes and concepts clearly and effectively to drive improved staff performance. Ability to liaise with other operational leaders to obtain support and knowledge. The Director, Territory Sales is accountable for the end to end financial results of sales within the assigned territory, with an average of 176 store locations. You will direct a team of (5+) Sr. Manager, Market Sales leaders and build a culture that is engaging, and encourages innovation, knowledge sharing, and profitable growth. As the Director, Territory Sales you will: Be accountable for the end to end execution of sales business results, not limited to sales, margin, complex sales, cost control, store profitability and EVA within the territory. Implement and drive the execution of sales strategies, plans, and objectives within the assigned territory. Be responsible for maximizing return on investment, profit & loss, daily operations, and people development of the Sr. Manager, Market Sales (5+). Communicate regularly with Territory leaders (TGMs) and other Territory, Market, and District Managers regarding business priorities and plans. Teach, coach, and drive shared responsibility for corporate led initiatives. Lead and develop team members with coaching, training, career counseling and direct performance development through use of business performance and personal development goals. This position is responsible to receive and ship merchandise to/from store and to stock merchandise in the warehouse or on the sales floor. 80% of your time you will: Receive and ship store merchandise: Removes merchandise from truck and compare against packing list. Applies security tag to product and moves it to sales floor or warehouse storage. Packages merchandise for shipment and completes bill of lading for transfers Packages merchandise for shipment to return to Distribution Centers. Operates equipment according to company safety standards to assist in moving merchandise. Stocks merchandise on the sales floor. Assists in the receiving of drop shipments Prepares merchandise for home delivery. Accurately documents movement of merchandise. Completes paperwork for store receiving, transfers, home delivery, DEVO, Junk Out. 10% of your time you will: Provide and maintain store appearance: Ensures clean parking lot, sidewalks, store entry, aisles, restrooms, warehouse area. Properly disposes of debris, boxes. 10% of your time you will: Provides carryout service for customers: Safely loads merchandise in customer’s vehicle. Verifies receipt against merchandise.  Learning Consultant: The Consultant, Learning Strategy is responsible for collaborating with business leaders, subject-matter experts, instructional designers, and technology teams to ensure successful execution of enterprise-wide training strategy. This involves translating complex learning needs into a set of effective learning solutions to be implemented across the Discover organization. The Learning Consultant will clearly define the learning solution strategy, including learning goals, set the development project up for success by ensuring the design team and/or vendors have the right information and resources, and ensure effectiveness of the solution through measurement strategies. The individual in this role will leverage learning expertise and their ability to navigate business partner relationships to successfully deploy learning strategies that will effectively meet business needs while resulting in a high quality learner experience. The individual in this role also leads cross- functional team problem-solving efforts to ensure our ability to meet regulatory requirements as well as learner needs. Responsibilities: Consult with stakeholders comprised of business unit leadership and stakeholders, HR, and Training and Development colleagues to gain a deep understanding of learning needs. Reframe the needs to optimize the learning experience and align with broader learning strategy. Conduct thorough needs analyses to assess the current state, identify the key performance and skills/knowledge gaps, and devise optimal learning solutions. Recommend the appropriate development solutions to drive key organizational results and identify contextual constraints that must be satisfied for a program to succeed. Develop a business case and translate needs into well-documented requirements. Oversee the development or acquisition of relevant learning content and ensure its quality. This will require reviewing and evaluating off-the shelf training solutions in the marketplace or internal/external design efforts. Partner with the LMS team, training operations, and other project teams to ensure successful implementation execution of training initiatives. Devise and follow processes to optimize hand-offs; strive to continually improve processes. Oversee the analysis and reporting of effectiveness and quality measures across functional learning programs. Analyze all relevant data and take the appropriate actions to improve overall quality and effectiveness of our programs. Identify connections to broader business impacts. Partner with analytics team members to… Promote a risk-aware culture, ensure efficient and effective risk and compliance management practices by adhering to require standards and processes. Skills: Skills Required: Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s degree in education, business, related field preferred 6+ years’ experience in a learning function, ideally with a learning design or program management background; 8+ years preferred Excellent communication, critical thinking and problem-solving skills functioning as a strong consultant to stakeholders Proven expertise in (and passion for) learning design and needs assessment Proven ability to manage stakeholders relationships Strong process and project management skills High level of comfort with ambiguity LI-NB1 We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.
 Head Of Training: What is the Position? As Head of Training you will own the design and execution of both our Concierge onboarding training and ongoing training. You’ll ensure training covers 1) day-to-day content 2) workflow and tooling processes 3) soft skills and anything else needed for our teams to perform at the highest levels on a day to day basis. You are setting the standard for the culture of the department. You’ll develop materials and modules in a way that makes the most sense for new hires to digest, and create a program for ongoing trainings once folks are in their roles. You’ll work with our other Concierge support functions to identify gaps in knowledge areas and ensure refreshers are easily accessible to teams. You’ll coach your team to train in an effective and engaging manner that sticks. Expect a fast paced training environment -- we onboard 20+ Care Guides and Concierge support staff every 2 weeks. Our current staff is 240+ on the Concierge Ops frontlines. Must-have qualities include: Training & Development background. You’ve scaled training programs at large organizations before and have done training yourself. You know what works and how adults best respond to different formats. You have 6-10+ years of training and instructional design experience. Leadership skills. People naturally navigate towards you. You own a room and are able to direct people with confidence. Organizational and prioritization skills. You know what to prioritize and when. You hold people accountable, and your team never drops the ball. People management. You’ll be managing a team of trainers - you’ll need to coach, act as a role model, and keep your team on track. You have 4+ years of management experience. Strong at synthesizing information. You can distill complex problems and put them into digestible formats for training. Collaborative. You love working with different kinds of people and are a relationship builder at heart. You work well with other teams and are able to get their buy in for content generation and upkeep. A good communicator. You’ll be leading the training team and need to teach others how to communicate to large audiences Independence and scrappy attitude. You’re a problem solver with a ‘get sht done’ mentality. You work with urgency. In your first 30 days you will… Become an expert in all things Concierge - you’ll be a sponge for content, tools and workflows. You should shadow and immerse yourself in all things we do. Deep dive into our current trainings and identify where gaps exist in terms of 1) content 2) delivery. Interview stakeholders within Concierge to understand what works for frontlines, and what areas we can do better in. Create a framework for ongoing training and onboarding training. In your first 60-90 days you will… Revamp the way onboarding training is delivered in the classroom, via video, learning groups -- be creative! Deliver training to new classes and manage the way your trainers deliver trainings. Roll out ongoing training calendar for reps. Get feedback on your programs and iterate. At Oscar, being an Equal Opportunity Employer means more than upholding discrimination-free hiring practices. It means that we work to cultivate an environment where exceptional people can be their most authentic selves and find both belonging and support. We're on a mission to change healthcare -- an experience made whole by your unique background and perspectives. Pay Transparency Policy: Oscar's Pay Transparency Policy ensures that you won't be discharged or discriminated against based on whether you've inquired about, discussed, or disclosed your pay. Read the full policy here ( https://assets.ctfassets.net/plyq12u1bv8a/1rF5ZOK4Cc2wcKQqYMu86W/6a7f199b884d9f38395878c624fe8587/Oscar_Health_Pay_Transparency_Policy.pdf ).
 Customer Service Specialist: What does a Best Buy Customer Service Specialist do? The Best Buy Customer Service Specialist provides fast, accurate and friendly processing for all customer transactions at Checkout, Customer Service and Store Pickup while providing velocity solutions to customers. Develops strong relationships with customers while becoming a trusted advisor and partner in assisting them in making technology more functional in their lives. Partners with other employees to ensure customers' end-to-end needs are met and that no customer is left unserved or underserved. Utilizes all relevant sales tools to drive profitable growth and exceed department and individual goals. Helps answer questions and resolve customer issues. Job responsibilities include: Flex as coverage between Checkout, Store Pickup and Customer Service as necessary Accountable for driving positive NPS results at Checkout, Store Pickup and Customer Service. Maintain professional communication with customers and peers while using cross-functional company resources and tools. Engage customers using soft skills while solving issues, providing end-to-end solutions with fast and accurate processing of transactions. Ensure Front of Store cleanliness and merchandising standard execution. What are the Professional Requirements of a Best Buy Customer Service Specialist? Basic Qualifications Ability to work successfully as part of a team Strong ability to prioritize and multi-task in a fast-paced environment Ability to work a flexible schedule inclusive of holidays, nights and weekends Preferred Qualifications High School Diploma or equivalent 3 months experience in retail, customer service or related fields What are my rewards and benefits? Surrounded by the latest and greatest technology, a team of amazing coworkers and a work environment where anything is possible, you’ll find it easy to be your best when you work at Best Buy. While you’re making technology work for our customers, we’re making sure Best Buy works for you with our pay for performance philosophy. At Best Buy we offer top salaries for management, including both short and long term incentive plans based upon business results, as well as endless opportunities to grow in a dynamic work environment that’s part of an industry that never sleeps. From tuition reimbursement to deep employee discounts, to health, wealth and wellness benefits, we believe the success of our company depends on the passion of employees for learning, technology and people.
 Inside Curriculum Specialist - K-12 Humanities: Description At Pearson, we’re committed to a world that’s always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. From bringing lectures vividly to life to turning textbooks into laptop lessons, we are always reexamining the way people learn best, whether it’s one child in our own backyard or an education community across the globe. We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explore new frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires us to always be better. By pushing the boundaries of technology — and each other to surpass these boundaries — we create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for the world’s innovations, personal and global, large and small. As a highly skilled Inside Curriculum Specialist, you will provide exceptional sales and introductory product orientation training for print, digital and blended learning programs, partnering with other specialists and share responsibilities for assigned regions. Your ability to drive educators, at all levels, to make sound decisions regarding learning outcome choices for students and teachers, will allow you to remain actively involved with K-12 education! You will be able to provide and communicate your expertise on national education standards, current education pedagogy and market trends. As a strong communicator, you will have the opportunity to develop and maintain ongoing relationships that involve all levels of state, regional, or district K-12 employees; superintendent, administrator, teacher, and para-professionals! If you are a self-starter with a passion for K-12 education, this is the time to be part of Pearson and keep the whole world learning. Because where learning flourishes, so do people! This exciting opportunity is at our Chandler, Arizona site location (No relocation assistance available) . Here is what you will get to do: \+ Work in partnership with Account General Managers throughout the region as a content specialist Support the sales process from prospecting to close for Pearson products, services and solutions respective to your portfolio in assigned markets \+ Partner directly with the Market Sales Teams and product management to advance Pearson products, services and solutions in your market \+ Responsible for contributing to the achievement of revenue targets as assigned \+ Deliver winning presentations for each sales cycle to include: exhibits/ conferences, pre-work/issue setting workshops, meetings/campaigns, pilots, sales presentations, and program activation \+ Develop relationships with key k-12 decision makers within the market segment \+ Maintain content level expertise through the Pearson certification process \+ Deliver program activation trainings for new and on-going customer accounts \+ Collaborate with internal Pearson teams including sales, services, and product management Qualifications Required Skills/Knowledge/Abilities: \+ BA/BS Degree; Master’s is preferred \+ 5 years of K-12 education experience to include classroom teaching experience Humanities \+ Expert knowledge of education theory and market trends in assigned content area (Humanities) \+ Proven success and experience with virtual delivery \+ Deep knowledge and passion for learning in K-12 education \+ Exceptional Self-starter \+ Extraordinary ability to network with district administrators and decision makers at all levels of state, regional and/or district K-12 employees \+ Demonstrated ability to deliver winning presentations in large and small groups \+ Strong proficiency with technology, including the ability to use various presentation software and hardware Additional Pluses: \+ Specialty training or advanced certification \+ Previous experience in selling and servicing to the education market \+ Active participation of knowing competitive landscape Pearson fuels the growing demand for effective education and high-quality information in the global knowledge economy, and share a common goal: to help people get on in their lives through education. Remote Help Desk Tech: Overview We are looking for people to join a Remote Help Desk team that is not like other Remote Help Desk teams. Would you like to work in a dynamic fast-moving environment that values social interaction as well as technical prowess? We pride ourselves on hiring bright, driven, enthusiastic people that have experience in supporting in primarily PC environments but can also handle a Mac equally well. Our workplace is where you will sharpen existing skills and develop new ones around new technology as it emerges. It is a bright, vibrant, challenging environment that leave you feeling like you’ve helped make an impact. We need people who can hold a conversation as well as resolve complex technical issues effectively and efficiently through multiple mediums (chat, ticket, phone). We want people for whom going “over and above” is second nature, who value the people behind the problems, and for whom technology is their passion. We want to deliver the best IT Help Desk experience in the world and if you think you are up to the challenge... read on... Responsibilities Applies critical thinking to complex user requests and provides as much context and information as possible to deliver the best solutions as quickly as possible. Troubleshoots client-side network connectivity issues, including digital authentication, remote access, secure Wi-Fi and wired connectivity to the internal network. Supports user requests and performs remote installations as needed. Assists remote users with access problems ranging from password resets to network access failures. Supports messaging & calendaring services and content collaboration. Support issues with mobile devices. Leads in ticket processes and provides coaching for other technicians when workflow deficiencies are identified. Has deep understanding of defined team metrics, such as backlog, aging, effectiveness; this technician then takes actions based on the current trends in Service. Attends and participates in weekly team syncs by driving actionable discussions. Displays learning agility by actively seeking answers when technically challenged. Seeks feedback from other Help Desk Technicians to optimize and improve support, while also maintaining a solid understanding of general user support needs and requirements. Qualifications As a Remote Help Desk Technician, you are the face of IT. Strong interpersonal communication skills with a high degree of empathy is a must. Complete understanding of Microsoft Outlook™ client (Windows & Mac) and Outlook Web Access, with experience resolving complex problems and assisting users with advanced functionality. Experience in supporting PCs and Windows OS in a commercial or enterprise environment is preferred. Applied experience with Microsoft Exchange™ including a firm understanding of Groups and permissions is key. Comprehensive knowledge of Windows is a plus, in issues ranging from resolving registry conflicts to troubleshooting system crashes and performance issues. Strong knowledge of supporting iOS and Android devices in a commercial or enterprise environment is preferred. Deep understanding of fault domain isolation, and root-cause analysis is essential for success in this role. Working knowledge of Active Directory and basic AD administration is desirable. Proven experience resolving secure network access problems involving but not limited to digital certificate authentication and client remote access services—either using Juniper Networks or Cisco solutions. Working knowledge of video collaboration, including tools like Zoom, BlueJeans Network and WebEx.

An innovative thinker, they will support projects and programs that enable our Employee Experience. This role supports all phases of the Employee Experience through strong partnerships within the Human Resources Department, cross-functional teams and employees at all levels that strive to impact process improvement and employee engagement. The ideal candidate, working closely with the business, will facilitate, design and deliver learning solutions focused on leadership development and employee engagement. This person will implement and measure initiatives that drive employee and team capabilities to enable the business to meet their organizational objectives. Leadership, design or OD experience strongly preferred 2-4 years’ experience in Employee Engagement, Building Culture, Learning, Leadership Development and/or Human Performance Technology Strong relationship building skills and ability to partner with all levels of the business in a fast-paced, fast-growth, and complex business environment Strong client management skills and ability to contract with business unit leaders and collaborate with HR partners in a fast-paced, fast-growth, and complex business environment A successful track-record navigating and delivering results in a matrixed organization, with experience of operating globally Highly articulate communication skills. Writes well-structured and persuasive end products, probes deep on key issues, draws customer into problem solving, articulate and persuasive, synthesizes information well, is in command of the audience and turns presentations into constructive dialogues, develops comprehensive communication plans Leverages Adult Learning Methodology to conduct needs analysis, design for both IL and web-based delivery, develops collateral, and uses data and metrics in overall approach. Experience with authoring tools. E-Learning program experience preferred Project Management experience. DDI or Situational Leadership) Certificate in change management, project management, organizational development, instructional design or related discipline

 Asset Protection Associate: What does a Best Buy Asset Protection Associate do? At Best Buy our mission is to leverage the unique talents and passions of our employees to inspire, delight, and enrich the lives our customers through technology and all its possibilities. If you have a passion and curiosity for what is possible and enjoy people, we invite you to join us on this mission. A Best Buy Asset Protection Associate coaches and leads employees in asset protection best practices to ensure a safe, secure and profitable environment throughout the store. They work with the Asset Protection Lead to resolve any hazards or compliance issues and investigate any accidents. They also demonstrate preparedness and exhibit behaviors for proper emergency response procedures. At Best Buy we give you plenty of ways to challenge yourself. You’ll find working in a high-paced retail environment increases your ability to solve problems, multitask and work in a team environment. Further, our leadership is committed to helping you succeed in your current role and prepare you for the next through coaching and performance appraisals. 40% of your time you will: Monitor the store for potential security risks and alarm function. Protect against fraudulent activity by creating AP Alerts and reporting and documenting incidents properly when necessary. 30% of your time you will: Teach and coach store employees about the principles, standards and policies related to safety and crisis events and monitor their fulfillment. Work with the Asset Protection Lead and others to resolve any hazards or compliance issues and investigate any employee or customer accidents. 30% of your time you will: Interact with customers and store employees to maintain a safe and profitable environment. What are the Professional Requirements of a Best Buy Asset Protection Associate? Basic Qualifications Ability to work successfully as part of a team Ability to work a flexible schedule inclusive of holidays, nights and weekends Ability to lift or maneuver 50-100 pounds, with or without accommodations Preferred Qualifications 3 months experience in retail, customer service or related fields What are my rewards and benefits? Discover your career here! At Best Buy we offer much more than a paycheck. Surrounded by the latest and greatest technology, a team of amazing coworkers and a work environment where anything is possible, you’ll find it easy to be your best when you work with us. We provide an exciting work environment with a community of techno learners where you can be yourself while investing in your career. Empowered with knowledge you will discover endless opportunities to grow. From deep employee discounts to tuition reimbursement, to health, wealth and wellness benefits, to learning and development programs, we believe the success of our company depends on the passion of employees for learning, technology and people.
Merchandising Specialist: What does a Best Buy Merchandising Specialist do? At Best Buy our mission is to leverage the unique talents and passions of our employees to inspire, delight, and enrich the lives of our customers through technology and all its possibilities. If you have a passion and curiosity for what is possible and enjoy people, we invite you to join us on this mission. This position is responsible to implement assigned responsibilities from Merchandising Senior in merchandising designated areas, upstocks merchandise to ensure department is continually stocked and replenished, and confirms the accuracy and timeliness of implementing special program guidelines. You will also assist customers in locating product. 45% of your time you will: Following weekly merchandising packet instructions, merchandises designated areas: Checks in drop shipments, truck shipments, and GEO shuttles. Confirms products are put on sales floor properly and in a timely manner. Arranges product according to planogram specifications. Performs ad set, price change, clean & bright, functionality and farming duties. Insure check-out lanes are set with proper product in each line. 25% of your time you will: Monitors floor merchandise: Upstocks overstock product when necessary. Downstocks product when necessary. Moves all product off of the sales floor prior to opening. 20% of your time you will: Ensures program guidelines are followed: Confirms Raincheck Follow up is completed. Confirms functionality checks are complete and problems reported to the manager. Brings "lock-up" product to front checkout lanes for customer purchases. Confirms closeout and open item program guidelines are followed. 10% of your time you will: Greets customer and assists with locating product What are the professional requirements of an Merchandising Specialist? Basic Qualifications Ability to work successfully as part of a team Ability to work a flexible schedule inclusive of holidays, nights and weekends Ability to lift or maneuver 50-100 pounds, with or without accommodations Preferred Qualifications 3 months experience in retail, customer service or related fields What are my rewards and benefits? Surrounded by the latest and greatest technology, a team of amazing coworkers and a work environment where anything is possible, you’ll find it easy to be your best when you work at Best Buy. While you’re making technology work for our customers, we’re making sure Best Buy works for you with our pay for performance philosophy. From tuition reimbursement to deep employee discounts, to health, wealth and wellness benefits, we believe the success of our company depends on the passion of employees for learning, technology and people.
Induction Achievement Advisor: Purpose Statement The purpose of the Achievement Advisor is to effectively use a variety of instructional practices, coaching and leadership skills to develop deep understanding of curriculum, instruction, and assessment and provide ongoing, targeted support for site-based and district-wide students, teachers and other AA colleagues across disciplines. Essential Functions 1\. Instructional Support  Model, whisper coach, and/or co-teach with effective instructional practices for teachers and other AAs  Collaborate with district and site Achievement Advisors and administrators to provide in-class support  Collaborate with classroom teachers to improve instruction  Support teachers and administrators in developing a teaching-learning model to increase students’ achievement of grade level curriculum  Analyze and interpret data to drive instructional support  Conduct consistent, in-the-moment, in-class support for all teachers  Provide teachers with in-the-moment support who are on support plans upon site administrator and/or district director request  Lead teachers through the lesson planning process to ensure instruction is aligned with state standards  Facilitate reflective conferences with teachers when appropriate 2\. Professional Development Facilitation  Analyze and interpret data to drive instruction and professional development  Assist with the planning, creation, facilitation, and implementation of site and district professional development  Conduct in-service programs for teachers and staff as required by federal, state, district and/or site initiatives 3\. Collaborative Team Support  Support grade-level and content-specific teams through a collaborative inquiry process of implementing curriculum, instruction, and assessment effective practices  Create and evaluate curricula and assessments at the site and district-wide  Provide evidence-based strategies to staff for student support 4\. Student Intervention and Remediation  Provide direct instructional services to targeted students for intervention and remediation  Analyze and interpret data to drive explicit instruction  Develop short term and long term plans of student support to be implemented 5\. Other duties as assigned as related to the job description Job Requirements: Minimum Qualifications SKILLS are required to perform single, non-technical tasks with a potential need to upgrade skills in order to meet changing job conditions. KNOWLEDGE of effective teaching and learning methods and techniques is required. Knowledge is required to follow instructions and understand multi-step written and oral instructions. ABILITY is required to implement the following attributes:  Demonstrate knowledge and experience in evidence-based teaching and effective professional development strategies  Demonstrate the ability to act resourcefully to differentiate for all students and adult learners  Demonstrate the ability to use multiple methods of assessment and analyze resulting data  Demonstrate the ability to demonstrate leadership and work collaboratively  Demonstrate the ability to utilize teacher assessment data, prior knowledge and interest to effectively plan and facilitate professional development and coaching  Demonstrate the ability to utilize student assessment data, prior knowledge and interest to effectively plan a classroom lesson and/or intervention  Demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of curriculum, instruction, assessment, and professional development for a range of grade levels and content areas  Demonstrate excellent oral and written communication skills and basic technology skills  Demonstrate competent skills for facilitating training Responsibility Responsibilities include: working under limited supervision following standardized practices and/or methods; providing information and/or advising others. Achievement Advisors are on a teacher contract and paid based on the teacher salary schedule. AAs are paid a stipend for 20 required, additional work days added to the teacher contract. Working Environment The usual and customary methods of performing the job's functions require the following physical demands: significant lifting, carrying, pushing, and/or pulling; significant climbing and balancing; frequent stooping, kneeling, crouching, and/or crawling; and significant fine finger dexterity. Generally the job requires 20% sitting, 40% walking, and 40% standing. The job is performed under minimal temperature variations and in a generally hazard free environment. Experience A minimum of 3 years of successful teaching experience in appropriate content area(s). Education Master’s degree in Curriculum and Instruction, Educational Leadership or appropriate content area is desired. Equivalency None specified

KIND Brand Ambassador - Mobile Team Captain - Phoenix: Job Description: Who are we? Since its founding in 2004, KIND has been on a mission to make the world a little kinder one snack and one act at a time. KIND was born out of its founder’s desire to create a snack that was healthy and tasty, wholesome and convenient. What began as a line of premium Fruit & Nut bars sparked the creation of an entirely new healthier snacking category. Today, KIND has a family of snacks that offer solutions for a variety of different occasions. We love making snacks that delight people’s taste buds and fuel their bodies, and we also love inspiring kindness in communities everywhere. As a not-only- for-profit company, we’ve always believed that there’s more to business than just profit. We’re looking for passionate collaborators to help us become the foremost leader in health & wellness and positively impact society along the way. If you’re looking to be a part of an inspiring, energetic and entrepreneurial environment, you’ve found the right place. What you’ll do As a KIND Brand Ambassador - Mobile Team Captain (KBA) you will be the face of the brand at various field marketing events and sampling activations, including key events, opportunistic samplings, and retail support. In this role, you will largely be responsible for the mobile sampling efforts of the Field Marketing team, and be part of a group of ambassadors occasionally relied upon and responsible for driving the KIND vehicle. This is how you will do it… Retail Activations Coordinate in - store demos with store managers and demo coordinators on schedules, product levels and demo guidelines. Create a unique customer experience to increase brand awareness and build customer loyalty, and ultimately drive in-store sales. Capture demo results by timely reporting on all pertinent information into the tracking system including gathering important insights and consumer feedback to present to KIND Headquarters. Represent all KIND product lines across the entire portfolio, with a strong understanding of nutrition and key functions and benefits of ingredients. Maintain relationships with existing sales accounts through POS placement and store merchandising and other retail activations. Marketing Events Support marketing events relevant to the brand and to the region. You’ll be responsible for partnering with like-minded companies in your region. Participate in strategic coordination and execution of sampling initiatives, reaching consumers where they live, play and shop. Build & Maintain Relationships Seed and develop new relationships with market influencers, ultimately leading to increased brand visibility. Communicate success stories, key learnings, and other activities to your Field Marketing Team Lead. Amplify KIND initiatives through personal network and social media support. Engage and educate consumers through mobile occasion sampling. Spread Kindness Do unexpected acts of kindness for others. Required Experience: What you’ll bring to KIND A background in customer service, which has strengthened your skills to provide a stellar customer experience. An energetic and entrepreneurial spirit. Deep understanding of what it takes to execute a successful event. You are… Down to earth, fun and have a 'work hard, play hard' mentality. An executor of account based marketing strategies that align to revenue goals. Naturally outgoing and internally motivated in your personal and professional efforts. A relationship builder, excited by the opportunity to partner with our customers and consumers. A results oriented self-starter. Able to maintain direction and focus by leveraging organizational abilities and proactive planning. A multi-tasker with the ability to prioritize competing tasks. Genuine in your desire to help make the world a kinder place, committing to always spreading and celebrating kindness. Willing to regularly work early mornings, evenings, and weekends based on company needs. You have… 2 years of relevant experience in events, promotions, media or consumer products marketing. Reliable transportation and a valid driver’s license with a clean driving record. The ability and willingness to transport KIND supplies in personal vehicle when needed. Celebrated your 21st birthday (requirement for our driver’s insurance for the KIND Jeep) and comfortable driving KIND vehicle in heavy traffic and city centers The ability to positively engage the public, representing the brand in a highly positive manner. An existing network of relevant contacts, specifically within active lifestyle, culture and business. An understanding of both marketing & sales fundamentals. A deep-rooted understanding of the relevant marketing and surrounding area. Mastered the ability to work autonomously and collaboratively. Access to a computer for reporting sampling results, and are well versed in Microsoft PowerPoint & Excel. Access to a personal smart phone for schedule updates, photo capturing, and emails. The ability to lift heavy items including tents, tables, and boxes up to 50 lbs. The ability to be in contact with and handle food products that contain nuts or food products made in a facility that processes nuts. Pluses A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience. What KIND offers Casual dress code - wear your KIND gear. A dynamic, ambitious, fun and KIND environment. The opportunity and responsibility to be KIND every day. Function Manager: General Responsibilities As a Function Manager (FM) you will be given the opportunity to further hone your management and leadership skills while driving results across one or more areas of operations. You will be assigned specific area(s) such as IR, Counter, Gold/Exit Gate, or Bus. As a Functional Manager you will work on the day-to-day aspects of the rental car business while using superior management, leadership and customer service skills. You will work with a wide range of employees, customers, vendors, and third party contractors to achieve the overall results and goals for your area of operations. You are responsible for managing a unionized and/or non- unionized workforce, delivering quality customer service, increasing sales and revenue, scheduling adequate staff coverage, handling escalated customer issues and requests, recruiting new employees and providing them with training. You will be an expert in all of Hertz products and services and will coach employees how to improve their ability to sell and meet customer needs. Additionally, depending on your assigned area you will be responsible for the rental fleet at your location including staying aware of hourly reservations, return counts, vehicle make and model availability, preventative maintenance schedules, etc. to achieve the greatest revenue and profitability Mandatory Requirements To be a Great FM you need: Commitment to developing and learning a wide variety of skills so that you can advance to higher levels at Hertz A desire to grow with Hertz including a willingness to live and work in a number of different cities throughout the United States A deep desire to work with and lead others as a team to build a business that is both fast paced and continually improving An ability to manage all aspects of the rental car business from Customer Service, Sales, Fleet Management, Maintenance, Vehicle Service, Vehicle Replenishment and Financial Analysis An ability to remain level headed and calm with both customers and employees as you assist them through challenging situations An ability to be a Hertz Brand Ambassador at all times as you seek to create a positive environment and solutions that generate continued customer and employee loyalty Skills Strong management, communications, interpersonal relationship, customer service, problem solving, fleet management, and sales skills Strong planning and logistical skills An Associate’s Degree required and a four-year degree is preferred for this role Preferred Requirements Hertz is a Drug-Free Workplace. All employment is contingent on successful completion of drug and background screening. EEO/AA: Females/Minorities/Disabled/Vets

Work with project teams and directors to identify all warranty requirements and obligations. Lead project teams to develop warranty plans to provide clients high value warranty services. Develop the pricing, scopes and terms for the O&M offering Develop an O&M advisory program to help clients ensure they are performing O&M that results in better performing plants as well as meeting warranty and legal requirements. Lead the commissioning team improving performance testing and inspection providing customers and McCarthy team to understand the plant’s ability to meet the long-term performance. Lead the performance modeling integrating current plant performance into the modeling best practices. Develop staff growth plans for each of the staff supporting warranty, O&M, commissioning and performance modeling. Build a post construction culture of continually learning from our operating facilities focused on providing clients top value energy production with reliable, high performing facilities. Business Acumen: The director for this position needs to have an ability to develop a vision for the post construction offering that supports the growth of the business. PV Plant Performance Analysis and Troubleshooting: The individual needs to have a deep understanding of PV plant performance and identify issues that impacts the performance. Plant Commissioning: Have an understanding of commissioning and ability to work with the commissioning leader to improve the processes. Performance Modeling: Understand PV system modeling and specifically PV Syst.  Market 14 Deployment Functionality Technician (Overnight): What does a Best Buy Deployment Functionality Technician (DFT) do? At Best Buy our mission is to leverage the unique talents and passions of our employees to inspire, delight, and enrich the lives of our customers through technology and all its possibilities. If you have a passion and curiosity for what is possible and enjoy people, we invite you to join us on this mission. The overnight Deployment Functionality Technician (DFT) is responsible for the implementation and functionality of the low voltage portions of Deployment Projects. This includes new interactive displays and IT network cabling and devices. They are solely responsible for the installation of the A/V infrastructure and for the maintenance and upkeep of all applicable merchandising standards. They use their merchandising and technical skills to complete the tasks associated with store Remodels, New Store Openings, Special Projects, and other company initiatives as assigned. 40% of your time you will: Implement new interactive displays and technologies during Remodels, Special Projects and New Store Openings 30% of your time you will: Install and maintain new and current IT and Audio/Video signal distribution in Best Buy stores and related company initiatives 20% of your time you will: Complete merchandising tasks, which include planogram assignments, clean and bright, implementing fixtures, signage and product security devices 10% of your time you will: Accountable for communicating and basic training of new displays and their functions to store employees What are the professional requirements of a Deployment Functionality Technician (DFT)? Basic Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent Must be 18 years or older Must be able to lift and move up to 50lbs Must be able to travel Must be willing and able to work overnight shifts Preferred Qualifications: 1 year of merchandising experience 1 year of cabling or IT experience What are my rewards and benefits? Achievement Advisor - Gifted: Purpose Statement The purpose of the Achievement Advisor is to effectively use a variety of instructional practices, coaching and leadership skills to develop deep understanding of curriculum, instruction, and assessment and provide ongoing, targeted support for site-based and district-wide students, teachers and other AA colleagues across disciplines. Essential Functions 1\. Instructional Support  Model, whisper coach, and/or co-teach with effective instructional practices for teachers and other AAs  Collaborate with district and site Achievement Advisors and administrators to provide in-class support  Collaborate with classroom teachers to improve instruction  Support teachers and administrators in developing a teaching-learning model to increase students’ achievement of grade level curriculum  Analyze and interpret data to drive instructional support  Conduct consistent, in-the-moment, in-class support for all teachers  Provide teachers with in-the-moment support who are on support plans upon site administrator and/or district director request  Lead teachers through the lesson planning process to ensure instruction is aligned with state standards  Facilitate reflective conferences with teachers when appropriate 2\. Professional Development Facilitation  Analyze and interpret data to drive instruction and professional development  Assist with the planning, creation, facilitation, and implementation of site and district professional development  Conduct in-service programs for teachers and staff as required by federal, state, district and/or site initiatives 3\. Collaborative Team Support  Support grade-level and content-specific teams through a collaborative inquiry process of implementing curriculum, instruction, and assessment effective practices  Create and evaluate curricula and assessments at the site and district-wide  Provide evidence-based strategies to staff for student support 4\. Student Intervention and Remediation  Provide direct instructional services to targeted students for intervention and remediation  Analyze and interpret data to drive explicit instruction  Develop short term and long term plans of student support to be implemented 5\. Other duties as assigned as related to the job description Job Requirements: Minimum Qualifications SKILLS are required to perform single, non-technical tasks with a potential need to upgrade skills in order to meet changing job conditions. KNOWLEDGE of effective teaching and learning methods and techniques is required. Knowledge is required to follow instructions and understand multi-step written and oral instructions. ABILITY is required to implement the following attributes:  Demonstrate knowledge and experience in evidence-based teaching and effective professional development strategies  Demonstrate the ability to act resourcefully to differentiate for all students and adult learners  Demonstrate the ability to use multiple methods of assessment and analyze resulting data  Demonstrate the ability to demonstrate leadership and work collaboratively  Demonstrate the ability to utilize teacher assessment data, prior knowledge and interest to effectively plan and facilitate professional development and coaching  Demonstrate the ability to utilize student assessment data, prior knowledge and interest to effectively plan a classroom lesson and/or intervention  Demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of curriculum, instruction, assessment, and professional development for a range of grade levels and content areas  Demonstrate excellent oral and written communication skills and basic technology skills  Demonstrate competent skills for facilitating training Responsibility Responsibilities include: working under limited supervision following standardized practices and/or methods; providing information and/or advising others. Achievement Advisors are on a teacher contract and paid based on the teacher salary schedule. AAs are paid a stipend for 20 required, additional work days added to the teacher contract. Working Environment The usual and customary methods of performing the job's functions require the following physical demands: significant lifting, carrying, pushing, and/or pulling; significant climbing and balancing; frequent stooping, kneeling, crouching, and/or crawling; and significant fine finger dexterity. Generally the job requires 20% sitting, 40% walking, and 40% standing. The job is performed under minimal temperature variations and in a generally hazard free environment. Experience A minimum of 3 years of successful teaching experience in appropriate content area(s). Education Master’s degree in Curriculum and Instruction, Educational Leadership or appropriate content area is desired. Equivalency None specified

 Technical Developer Communications Manager, Deep Learning Institute: NVIDIA is looking for an experienced Technical Developer Communications Manager to join our Developer Programs team. This role involves interacting with a variety of developers, data scientists and researchers worldwide to create highly technical deep learning case stories highlighting the challenging problems and breakthrough results people are accomplishing with our technologies. You will possess a good knowledge of deep learning and understand the software and hardware that developers are using to develop applications across industries, including automotive, healthcare, life sciences, manufacturing, robotics, and smart cities. Do you love diving into a technology and evangelizing success stories to others? Are you passionate about accelerated computing and enabling developers to do their best work? If so, we would like to learn more about you. What you’ll be doing: Identify and develop a diversified portfolio of technical developer case studies Train internal sales and marketing teams on the tools and software our developers are using to create deep learning applications Find creative, fresh ways to bring deep learning developer success stories to life Help build a measurable platform to provide insightful metrics on deep learning What we need to see: Bachelor’s degree in a scientific/technical discipline or communications. 8+ years’ experience developing and delivering powerful, compelling technical communication for internal audiences, developers and customers. Experienced presenting to sales teams, at conferences, in webinars, through blogs and social media. Excellent written and spoken communication, including advanced PowerPoint skills. Experience in technical writing Creative thinker and self-starter, someone who is persistent and inventive Ability to thrive in a large organization and collaborate with peers across business units and functions Strong organizational skills, capable of handling multiple projects at the same time Links to your relevant work, including technical writing Ways to stand out from the crowd: Do you clearly communicate your understanding of the company’s strategy and technology? Do you have measurable results you can share? (metrics, awards, key accomplishments) Do you demonstrate the ability to continually innovate, think strategically and orchestrate many moving parts? Can-do attitude and growth mindset NVIDIA's invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI - the next era of computing - with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. What will make this intelligent industrial revolution possible? A new computing model - GPU deep learning - that enables computers to learn from data and write software that is too complex for people to code. We are widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most talented people in the world working with us. Lead Python interface development of TensorRT SW library. This would include sample development using easy to use Python APIs and abstraction packages like TRT lite. Contrast’s agent easily installs onto any application server and finds vulnerabilities in less than 7 minutes without the need for security experts, static or dynamic scans. Our products are a perfect fit with Agile, DevOps and even waterfall methodologies, and work seamlessly on premise, in the cloud and in containers.
